title: love_deluxe
body:
The [[stand (jojo)|Stand]] of [[yamagishi_yukako|Yukako Yamagishi]] that lets her hair become [[prehensile_hair|prehensile]], extend to great lengths, makes it very durable, strong and so on.

Overuse of the Stand and/or excessive destruction of the hair generated by the Stand lets her hair turn white for a short period of time.

The likely namesake is [i]Love Deluxe[/i], the fourth studio album by the English group Sade (active since 1982), released on 26 October 1992 in the United States and on 1 November 1992 in the United Kingdom.

For the purposes of tagging, only use this tag if Yukako's hair is shown to be prehensile or much longer than is normal for her.

title: sunrise
body:
The [[sun]] crossing the [[horizon]] in the [[morning]]. If no sun is visible, tag it [[dawn]] or [[sunlight]] instead. Not to be confused with [[rising sun flag]].

Distinguishing between [[sunrise]] and [[sunset]] can be difficult, so only tag [[sunrise]] if the sky hues appear more white or yellow, as is most prevalent in media.

* !asset #24340888: Sunrise occurs after dawn

h4. See also

* [[sunset]]: the sun setting beneath the horizon
* [[dawn]]: time before sunrise with visible sunlight
* [[dusk]]: time after sunset with visible sunlight
* [[twilight]]: period between dawn-sunrise and sunset-dawn
* [[Sunrise (company)]] [tn] Anime studio [/tn]

title: swordfighter_peach
body:
One of [[Princess Peach|Princess Peach's]] transformations in [[Princess Peach: Showtime!]], where she can wield a [[rapier]].

In this form, she wears a [[two-sided coat]] of [[blue coat|blue]] and [[red coat|red]], along with a [[red vest]] and [[white pants]]. She also wears a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[cavalier hat]] adorned with a [[red rose]] and a [[hat feather]], a [[white ascot]] and a pair of [[blue footwear|blue]] [[knee boots]]. Her ponytail is also [[low ponytail|lower]].

h4. External Links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Swordfighter Peach":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Swordfighter_Peach]

title: suzi_q
body:
Supporting character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Parts 2 and 3. Assistant of [[Lisa Lisa]]. Later marries Part 2 protagonist [[Joseph Joestar (old)|]] and has a child named [[Kujo Holy]].

Originally introduced as just "Susie Q", her full name was revealed in the artbook [i]JoJo 6251[/i]. Following the musical naming motif of the series, her name may be a double reference to both the Dale Dawkins song "Susie Q" and the singer-songwriter Susan Kay "Suzi" Quatro.

title: luetzow_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Imperial German battlecruiser SMS [i]Lützow[/i].
[tn]Not to be confused with the much later Kriegsmarine heavy cruiser [i]Lützow[/i], who was sold to the Soviets as [[Tallinn (Azur Lane)|]]. Or [[Deutschland (azur lane)|]], who were later renamed into [i]Lützow[/i] following the sale of Tallinn.[/tn]

Note: Standard convention for "ü" is to write it as "ue" when ü is unavailable or inconvenient. For usability reasons Danbooru does not use 'accented' letters in tags.

In-game, she has partially [[braid]]ed [[long hair|long]] [[platinum blonde hair]] and grayish-purple eyes. Her outfit consists of a buttoned [[white shirt]] with [[breast pocket|breast pockets]], a black [[belt]] around a [[black skirt]], [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]], and a [[mini hat]].

Her rig is the standard Ironblood animalistic style, with her 30.5 cm twin gun mounts placed on either side.

title: maestrale_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Italian destroyer [i]Maestrale[/i] (lit. Mistral) in [[Azur Lane]]. 
Character design by [[Byulzzi]], voiced by Eino Airi.

In-game, she sports [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair]] (mostly [[white hair|white]] with red inner hair) and [[red eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white dress]], [[green jacket]], [[red armband]] with the [[Sardegna Empire (emblem)|]] emblem printed on it, and a black [[beret]] and a [[black ribbon]].

Her rig consists of two 120 mm twin gun mounts and two 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]], one gun and torpedo mount on each side. The bridge superstructure is mounted to her back and connects the two sides.

title: leander_(retrofit)_(azur_lane)
body:
In [[Leander (azur lane)|]]'s [[retrofit (azur lane)|]], her black shirt is swapped for a white shirt, and her old white shirt over-layer is replaced with a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket]]. Her wrist cuffs are replaced in favor of [[fingerless gloves]] that extend to just below her elbow, and have similar plaid trim to her skirt and sleeves. She gains a [[purple hairband]] and a [[purple bow]] as a bowtie. She now has anchors where the garter straps meet her thighhighs.

Her rigging maintains a mostly similar design, with the half hulls being more emptied out and thin, extending off of mechanical arms, as opposed to directly attached to the back.

h4. Appearance

[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the heavy cruiser USS [i]Louisville[/i] (CA-28).

Her default outfit consists of a two-color [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[blue dress|blue]] and [[white dress]] with a [[center opening]] exposing her [[cleavage cutout|cleavage]], and [[white thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]].

title: libeccio_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Italian destroyer [i]Libeccio[/i] (meaning the southwesterly winds) in [[Azur Lane]]. 
Character design by [[Byulzzi]], voiced by Eino Airi.

In-game, she has an identical appearance to her sister [[Maestrale (Azur Lane)|]], having [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair]] (mostly white with blue inner hair) and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white dress]], [[green jacket]], and a black [[beret]] and a [[black ribbon]]. Unlike her sister Maestrale, she lacks a [[red armband]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of two 120 mm twin gun mounts and two 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]], one gun and torpedo mount on each side. The bridge superstructure is mounted to her back and connects the two sides.

title: leander_(azur_lane)
body:
Lead ship of the Royal Navy Leander-class light cruisers, HMS [i]Leander[/i], [[Azur Lane]].

Leander has [[blue eyes]] and [[platinum blonde hair|platinum blonde]] [[long hair]]. She wears a [[black_shirt|black]] [[collared shirt]] with an open [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] on top, and a [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[high-waist skirt]]. Her waistband and shirt cuffs have [[plaid trim]], and a [[white ribbon]] with miniature [[anchor|anchors]] is tied under her shirt collar. She has [[wrist cuffs]] that are extended where the button binds. Below the waist, she has [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]] and brown [[loafers]].

Her [[rigging]] is a split hull design with 4 twin-[[ship turret|turrets]] and 2 quad-[[torpedo tubes]]. Two of her turrets are mounted directly onto the hulls, with the third being attached via a mechanical arm and the fourth being handheld. On her back is a [[smokestack]].

h4. Skins

* !post #2967475: [[leander (retrofit) (azur lane)|Retrofit]]

body:

title: le_temeraire_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the French destroyer [i]Le Téméraire[/i]. Original character design by [[Riichu]]. 

h4. Appearance

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|floor-length]] [[blonde hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and tied into [[twin braids]], [[green eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[frills|frilled]] [[white shirt]] top with a frilled [[blue capelet]] and a [[red ribbon]], blue [[corset]], [[white skirt]], frilled [[white thighhighs]], [[blue gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of two 533 mm twin [[torpedo tubes]], one mount on each side, a third triple torpedo mount to her back, a twin 130 mm gun mount on her right wrist, and a [[staff]].

title: goose
body:
A large waterfowl in the Anatidae family.

A gander is a male goose. Young birds are called goslings. A group of geese on the ground is a gaggle; when in flight, they are called a skein, team, or wedge; when flying close together, they are called a plump.

Geese are larger than [[duck]]s and smaller than most [[swan]]s.

h4. See also
* [[Canada Goose]]
* [[Greater White-fronted Goose]]
* [[Duck]]
* [[Swan]]
* [[Untitled Goose Game]]
* [[Tag Group:Birds]]

title: rotisserie
body:
A style of [[roasting]] where [[meat]] is skewered on a long solid rod call a [i]spit[/i] that is used to hold food while it is being cooked over a fire or roasted in an oven.

h6. Subtypes:

* [[Vertical rotisserie]]: A rotisserie where the spit is vertical.  A common feature of gyros and Doner kebabs.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: langley_(azur_lane)
body:
First Eagle Union (light) carrier, USS [i]Langley[/i] (CV-1), in [[Azur Lane]].

h5. Base Art

Langley has [[long hair|long]], [[wavy_hair|wavy]], mint-[[green hair]] with a [[single side bun]] on her left side and [[brown eyes]]. She wears a [[dress shirt]], a [[blue bow|blue]] [[bowtie]], a yellow [[vest]], a black [[pencil skirt]], and [[black pantyhose]]. She has a [[lab coat]] with an [[American flag print]] lining the inside, [[star print|stars]] on her right and [[striped|stripes]] on her left. She has [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]] with a [[rudder_footwear|rudder heel]]. She also wears oval [[glasses]] and wields a [[riding crop]].

Her [[rigging]] is her ship model split into her bow on her left, and her stern on her right. The hulls are painted white, and each have a brown [[flight deck]] with white markings.

h5. Retrofit Art

After her [[retrofit (azur lane)|retrofit]], she swaps out the dress shirt and vest combo for a [[sleeveless]] dress shirt with [[cleavage_cutout|cleavage]] and [[navel_cutout|navel cutouts]]. She also swaps the labcoat for a shoulderless [[black coat]] with alternating strips of starts and stripes. Her glasses are now rectangular as opposed to oval.

Her rigging now adopts a steel grey and black colorscheme. A notable difference is the bow-half is missing part of it's flight deck, a nod to her real life refit to a sea plane tender. Another difference is the bow and stern sections switched sides, with the bow on her right, and stern on her left.

In game, Langley is a teacher, often scolding the commander and bemoaning being treated like child due to her small stature (a nod to how small the ship was). Both her personality and her skill "First-Generation Carrier," which boosts carrier exp gain, are likely a nod to her role as the first USN carrier, allowing for early training of pilots.

Her plane loadout is entirely fighters, allowing her an incredible amount of air control/anti-plane ability for her rarity/oil cost.

title: wb_102
body:
Where the Federation Space Force is concerned, all mobile suits are marked according to their mothership. Katoki (and the Master Archive book) uses two-letter abbreviations, such as "WB" for White Base, "AL" for Albion, "MR" for Mariana, etc. The recent MSV-R series tends to use hull numbers instead - SBB-17 for the GM Cannons stationed aboard the Luzal, SVC-71 for the GM Intercept Customs assigned to the White Base II - but it's the same concept. That's a small enough group that they only need a couple of numbers to tell the mobile suits apart, and when they're using three digits, the first one is typically the team number and the second is normally zero.

Thus, Katoki's interpretation of the [b]RX-78 Gundam is marked "WB 102"[/b] because it's the second machine of the White Base's one and only mobile suit team. The machines of South Burning's "Immortal 4th Team" are labeled "LV 401" through "LV 404", which might mean their mothership carries multiple teams, or perhaps that it operates as part of a larger squadron where they need to be able to distinguish the teams...

Do not use if the character is [[topless]] or otherwise not wearing a shirt.

Examples: Most [[Strike Witches]] characters, or [[bismarck_(kancolle)]], [[yukikaze_(kancolle)]] from [[kantai collection]].

title: gorgon_(fate)
body:
The fully monstrous Avenger-class form of [[Medusa (fate)|]], appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Like Medusa, features [[purple hair]], [[very long hair]], a [[domino mask]], with [[huge_breasts|much bigger breasts]]. In addition, she gains [[monster girl|monstrous qualities]] such as [[claws]], [[scales]], [[snake]] hair, [[square_pupils|square]] or [[slit pupils]], and, in her final form, [[wings]].

Her outfit consists of a black or white [[bustier]], with a [[cleavage cutout]] and a long skirt with a [[pelvic curtain]], leaving the midriff and [[navel]] exposed.

Designed by [[Simosi]] and voiced by [[Asakawa Yuu]].

title: lethe_(fire_emblem)
body:
Playable Laguz unit in [i][[Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance]][/i] and [i][[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]][/i].

She is a Cat Laguz of the Gallian Beast tribe. She is the older twin sister of [[lyre (fire emblem)|Lyre]]. She's a prideful, proud, and decorated commander.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair|orange hair]] as well as [[purple eyes]].

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Cat

title: lyre_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Lyre[/b] (リィレ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]].

She is a Cat Laguz of the Gallian Beast tribe. She is the younger twin sister of [[lethe (fire emblem)|Lethe]] and possibly has feelings for Commander [[ranulf (fire emblem)|Ranulf]]. She hates fighting but joins the army to be with [[lethe (fire emblem)|Lethe]] and [[ranulf (fire emblem)|Ranulf]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair|orange hair]] often kept in a [[braid|braid]] as well as [[purple eyes]].

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Cat

title: tokino_sora_(1st_costume)
body:
The current default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Tokino Sora]]. It has been her default appearance since May 2018.

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[cropped shirt]], a [[blue vest|blue]] [[cropped vest]], a [[red bowtie]] or a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[wrist cuffs]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], a white [[waist cape]] with a [[rabbit tail|bunny]] [[fake tail|tail]], [[blue thighhighs]], a [[blue ribbon]] [[thigh ribbon|around her left thigh]] and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[winged footwear|winged]] [[ankle boots|ankle]] [[fold-over boots]] with [[high heel boots|high heel]]s. While her model would receive further updates after to improve its quality, her base costume would be iterated upon with its update for her 3rd Anniversary in 2020, with the additions to it being used to this day.

She has a more elaborate variation of her main costume, which was introduced for her first album [i]Dreaming![/i]. Her costume remains mostly the same but is generally more ornamented, with the addition of [[gold trim]] and an [[aiguillette]] on her vest, [[frills]] on her [[frilled cuffs|cuffs]],  [[gold chain]]s on her waistcape, and [[lace trim]] on her [[lace-trimmed skirt|skirt]]. Additionally she wears a short [[underbust]] [[corset]] and [[bracelet]]s with this costume.

For her original design and its variations, see [[Tokino Sora (old design)]].

h4. Appearance

On June 23, 2023, this costume received an "update":[https://twitter.com/watsonameliaEN/status/1672073651720683524], receiving new accessories, but more importantly allowing it to be recolored to a [[brown kimono|brown]] [[plaid kimono]] closer to her default color palette, nicknamed her 'waffle' kimono.

title: ellie_sattler_(jurassic_park)
body: Dr. Ellie Sattler is a fictional character in the [[Jurassic Park]] franchise. She is introduced in Michael Crichton's 1990 novel Jurassic Park, which began the franchise. [[Steven Spielberg]] directed the 1993 film adaptation, casting Laura Dern as Sattler and giving the character a more substantial role compared to the novel. She is a paleobotanist in both the novel and its film adaptation. In the novel, she is a student of Dr. [[Alan Grant]]. For the film, Spielberg made them a romantic couple, with Sam Neill portraying Grant.

title: jurassic_park
body:
A 1993 science fiction-adventure film about a cloned [[dinosaur]] theme park, and the chaos that ensues, is based on Michael Crichton's 1990 novel of the same name.
The book was successful, as was Steven Spielberg's 1993 film adaptation. The film received a theatrical 3D re-release in 2013, and was selected in 2018 for preservation in the United States National Film Registry by the Library of Congress as being "culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant". Crichton's 1995 sequel novel, The Lost World, was followed by a 1997 film adaptation, also directed by Spielberg. Crichton did not write any further sequels in the series, although Spielberg would return as executive producer for each subsequent film, starting with Jurassic Park III (2001).
h4.Plot
Scientists funded by billionaire John Hammond have discovered how to bring extinct animals back to life via a complex cloning process. To make a profit off of this technology, Hammond and his company, InGen, decide to build a theme park featuring living [[dinosaur|dinosaurs]]. This in itself would not be such a bad idea — except the organizers are rushing to get it open, have built it on a remote island, and have almost no security personnel, deciding instead to automate the whole thing with unreliable computers — even refusing to tell the software designer what the system is for.

Naturally, everything that can go wrong does go wrong. And Hammond's invited guests to this soft opening — paleontologist [[Alan Grant]], paleobotanist [[Ellie Sattler (Jurassic park)|]], chaotician [[Ian Malcolm]], lawyer Donald Gennaro and Hammond's own grandchildren Tim and Lex Murphy — are caught in the middle of it all.

H4. See Also
* [[Jurassic World]]
other_names: ジュラシック・パーク

title: lamia
body:
A [[monster girl]] whose upper body is human and whose lower body is [[snake]]-like. Lamia and naga are often rendered so similarly as to make it merely a matter of style which one a serpent-legged character will be called.

The term "naga":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nāga comes from Hinduism and Buddhism, and literally means "cobra". Naga can appear with varying degrees of humanity, but typically have fully human torsos. The term "lamia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamia comes from Greek, though its original usage did not possess snake-like qualities. It was only in the 1600s that "Robert Burton":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Burton_(scholar) ascribed the familiar qualities, which were subsequently popularized by "John Keats":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Keats in his poem "lamia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamia_(poem), published in July 1820.

The Japanese, apparently not having either of these myths as a major part of their tradition, tend to ascribe lamia/naga with personalities like those they associate with snakes in general and lamia are often the tsundere types.

h4. Notable Lamias

* !post #7278069: [[Alipheese Fateburn XVI]] from [i][[Mon-Musu Quest!]][/i]
* !post #6563514: [[Cassiopeia (league Of Legends)|]] from [i][[League of Legends]][/i]
* !post #98488: [[Deis]] from [i][[Breath of Fire]][/i]
* !post #2795203: [[Echidna (Granblue Fantasy)|]] from [i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i]
* !post #2258939: [[Echidna (P&D)|]] from [i][[Puzzle & Dragons]][/i]
* !post #7051802: [[Jashin-chan]] from [i][[Jashin-chan Dropkick]][/i]
* !post #2376255: [[Kiyohime (fate)|Kiyohime]] from [i][[Fate/Grand Order]][/i]
* !post #620989: [[Lamia Hygieia]] from [i][[Mamonomusume to no Seikatsu]][/i]
* !post #5298315: [[Miia (Monster Musume)|]] from [i][[Monster Musume no Iru Nichijou]][/i]
* !post #4020458: [[Saphentite Neikes]] from [i][[Monster Musume no Oisha-san]][/i]

h4. See also

body:
A company that hosts a livestreaming platform of the same name, made specifically for [[virtual YouTuber]]s, referred to as 'virtual livers' when they're on the platform.

IRIAM also has a large number of official VTubers in addition to those from other origins.

IRIAM launched an English version on November 15, 2024 as a United States-only beta release, and there are plans to expand to other countries.

title: sage_(dq3)
body:
A character class in [[Dragon Quest III]]. The Sage has the combined magical abilities of the [[Priest (dq3)|]] and [[Mage (dq3)|]], and is the only class that cannot be used at the start of the game. The only way to get a Sage is to change one of the other classes into one at the Alltrades Abbey found partway through the game. Most classes need Words of Enlightment to become a Sage, but the otherwise useless [[Gadabout (dq3)|]] can become a Sage without one.

The female Sage wears a short white dress and a blue cape, while the male wears a sleeveless blue robe. Both versions carry a wooden staff and wear a circlet, and have long blue hair. However, in the HD-2D remake of III, players can now customize the appearance of characters like the Sage.

h4. Official art

* !post #8467140

Selen has [[medium hair|medium]] [[purple hair]] in [[twin braids]] with [[hairclip|hairclips]] and [[ahoge]], [[heterochromia]] [[blue eyes|blue]] and [[purple eyes]], and [[pointy ears]] that are usually obscured by her [[purple wings|purple]] [[head wings]].

Additionally, some English-speaking fans refer to her as [b]Creatrix[/b] due to photos from the game tutorials using that name for her.

While the player is able to customize the main character, the Female Builder is typically portrayed with [[blonde hair]] in [[twintails]], [[blue eyes]], and with [[red ribbon]]s in her hair.

According to pre-release material, she is the descendant of either the [[male builder (dqb)|male]] or [[female builder (dqb)|female]] player character from [i][[Dragon Quest Builders]][/i].

title: jessica_albert
body:
One of the protagonists of [i][[Dragon Quest VIII]][/i] and the game's only playable female character, Jessica is a noblewoman who joins the party to avenge her brother [[Alistair Albert|Alistair's]] murder.  At first she is lacking in social niceties, coming off as bossy and pushy, but she eventually softens and becomes one of the [[Hero (dq8)|]]'s most important friends.

She is well-known for wearing a low-cut [[off-shoulder shirt]] that highlights her [[large breasts]], and even uses her sex appeal in combat to distract enemies.

Jessica also appears in [[Itadaki Street]], a [[Monopoly]]-style game for the [[Wii]] featuring characters from the [i]Dragon Quest[/i] and [i][[Mario (series)|]][/i] series.

h4. Official art
* !post #8503528

h4. External links:

* "Dragon Quest Wiki: Jessica Albert":http://dragon-quest.org/wiki/Jessica_Albert

title: naga_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A member of [[dazzling_pearl_(nikke)|Dazzling Pearl]] along with [[Tia (nikke)|Tia]].

The spiritual glue that holds Dazzling Pearl together. She dotes on the forgetful Tia much like an older sister does to ensure that she remembers things. Appears mature on a regular basis, but if an accessory catches her eye, she often indulges in impulse purchases and overspending.

She is a [[dark-skinned female]] and has [[yellow eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied in a [[side ponytail]] along with [[large breasts]]. Being a [[gyaru]], Naga's outfit is a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[crop top|cropped]] [[white shirt]] with [[necktie]] (which has a [[see-through bra|see-through]] [[black bra]]), [[highleg panties]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], a pair of [[loose socks]] and [[black footwear|black shoes]].

title: hambrabi
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RX-139 Hambrabi[/b]

A well armed, fast and nimble (but light armored) transformable [[mobile suit]] fielded by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] that is designed mostly for [[close-quarters combat|close combat]] and aero[[space]] assaults. It possesses beam weapons and  a total of five monoeye sensors all over it, which enable for great tracking of targets.  

The type's most famous pilot was [[Yazan Gable]]. [spoiler]Yazan's unit was destroyed by an enraged [[Kamille Bidan]] in his [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam]], but he survived its destruction inside an escape pod.[/spoiler]

title: ptsd
body:
[b]Post Traumatic Stress Disorder[/b] (modern term: [b]PTSD[/b]) is a [[crazy|mental disorder]] that can develop after a person is exposed to a very traumatic event, such as [[rape|sexual assault]], [[war]]fare, traffic collisions, or other threats on a person's life. Frequent among [[soldier]]s, it used to be called [b]Shell Shock[/b] ([[World War I]]) and [b]Combat Fatigue[/b] ([[World War II]]) in the past.  

Symptoms may include: paranoia, overvigilance, concealment of [[handgun]]s and other weapons for easy access, fear of unexisting treats, disturbing thoughts, feelings, or dreams related to the events (usually war flashbacks in most veterans); mental or physical distress to trauma-related cues; attempts to avoid trauma-related cues and alterations in how a person thinks and feels. 

The most severe cases may feature trauma-related visual and auditory "hallucinations":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hallucination with mental disturbances (such as severe "depression":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depression_(mood)) that could lead to [[suicide]] or full-on "psychosis":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychosis and [[vegetative_state|loss of contact with reality]].

h4. See also
* [[Survivor guilt]]
* [[The Two-Thousand Yard Stare]]
** [[Thousand yard stare]]

* [[John Rambo]]
* [spoiler][[Kamille Bidan]][/spoiler]

title: kamille_bidan
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

Main protagonist of [[zeta_gundam|Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam]] and a supporting character in [[gundam_zz|Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ]]. He is the dark [[blue hair]]ed pilot of the [[Gundam Mk II|RX-178 Gundam Mk-II]] and designer and pilot of the [[Zeta Gundam (mobile suit)|MSZ-006 Zeta Gundam]].

[b]Kamille Bidan[/b] has a huge complex regarding his name, which is why he takes up [[Mobile Suit]] engineering and [[karate]].

He gets into a fistfight with a [[Jerid Messa|Titans operative]] who makes a small jibe about his name, and things only go worse from there...

[spoiler]
In 2005~2006 film [b]Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam: A New Translation[/b], his fate (and personality) was drastically changed. A latent but powerful Newtype, after witnessing (and suffering) the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]' brutality firsthand Kamille becomes a mecha pilot and MS designer for the [[AEUG]]. At the end of the original series he is left with [[ptsd|severe mental disease]] and [[crazy|psychosis]] due to his duel with Titans officer and MS ace [[Paptimus Scirocco]], who attacked Kamille with a powerful [[newtype_flash|Newtype mental blast]] as he died, crushed by Kamille's [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam MS]] during the final battle of The Gryps War. Fortunately Kamille's [[vegetative state]] is reverted and his mind is eventually healed (thanks to [[Fa Yuiry]]'s constant care) at the end of Gundam ZZ. Years later he appears during the events of [[gundam_uc_0099:_moon_crisis|Moon Crisis]], now as a medical [[doctor]], having left the military for good and becoming a dedicated medicine student.[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Tobita Nobuo]].

h4. Kamille's Women
* [[Fa Yuiry]]
* [[Four Murasame]]
* [[Rosamia Badam]]
* [[Emma Sheen]]

body:

He also appears in [[Zeta Gundam]] (1985) as a youngster. Her nickname is based on Darjeeling tea "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

title: cleveland_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the light cruiser USS [i]Cleveland[/i] (CL-55) in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. 
Character design by [[Hao (patinnko)|]].

She has [[blonde hair]] in either a [[ponytail]] or [[one side up]], [[small breasts]], and [[red eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a fire-control director holding up her sidetail, a [[white cape]], [[blue jacket]], a very small [[miniskirt]], and star-spangled [[socks]].
Her [[rigging]] is the standard for her class, with two 15.2 cm triple mounts on the left and two 12.7 cm twin mounts on the right.

Cleveland is often nicknamed "Clevedad" by Chinese players, a carryover from [[world_of_warships|World of Warships]], similar to [[Belfast (azur lane)|]]'s nickname "Payfast" used by Western players, and also bears the nickname "Clevebro" due to her tomboyish and cavalier attitude.

She is sometimes wearing [[deal with it (meme)|]] [[sunglasses]], due to their use in one her emotes.

title: denver_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [i]Cleveland[/i]-class light cruiser USS [i]Denver[/i] (CL-58). Character design by [[Huanxiang Heitu]], voiced by [[Ozawa Ari]].

In-game, she is shown with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] tied in [[short twintails]], and [[blue eyes]]. She also wears a [[double-breasted]] [[black dress]], black [[knee boots]], and black legwear that matches the height of the knee boots. Unlike her sisters [[Cleveland (Azur Lane)|]], [[Montpelier (Azur Lane)|]], and [[Birmingham (Azur Lane)|]] that wear [[white cape|white capes]], she prefers a [[white coat]] with [[long sleeves]] and her name printed on it.

Her rigging is the same [i]Cleveland[/i]-class rig, with the 15.2 cm triple mounts on one side and 12.7 cm twin mounts on another.

title: lingsha_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] character. 

The new Cauldron Master of the Xianzhou Luofu's Alchemy Commission following the Ambrosial Arbor Crisis. Voiced by [[Maeda Kaori]] in Japanese. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[red eyes]], [[pointy ears]], [[colored extremities|red-colored skin]] on the arms and legs, and [[medium breasts]]. Her outfit consists of a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] black [[crop top]] held by a white [[criss-cross halter]], white [[wrist cuffs]], [[black skirt]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8651700: Splash art

h4. Profile
[expand]
"I am a Vidyadhara, born and raised on the Luofu, and I once studied the healing arts under the name of 'Dan Zhu.' But my master became bogged down in politics and was banished to a place far from home. I followed her there. Now that I've changed my name and come home, many complicated feelings have returned."

The new Cauldron Master of the Xianzhou Luofu's Alchemy Commission. An intelligent and quick-witted Vidyadhara healer. She has a sharp sense of smell and often uses this to diagnose illnesses, as well as utilizing incense to calm the minds of others.

She is adept at dealing with complicated social relationships. Though she might be fuming inside, her expression would remain calm and serene.
[/expand]

h4. See also

* [[Nuwa (Honkai Impact)|]] - Her [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] counterpart.
* [[Fuyuan (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] - Her "incense beast" companion.

title: manny_pacquiao
body:
Also known as "PacMan", he is a Filipino boxer, businessman, politician, actor, and singer. 

In boxing, he is the only eight-division world champion in its history and has won twelve major world titles. He was also the first boxer to win the lineal championship in four different weight classes, the first boxer to win major world titles in four of the eight "glamour divisions" (flyweight, featherweight, lightweight, and welterweight), and is the only boxer to hold world championships across four decades (1990s, 2000s, 2010s, and 2020s).

title: rear_naked_choke
body:
The rear naked choke (RNC) is a [[choke hold]] in martial arts applied from an opponent's back, which has an optional use of body scissors to further restrain the opponent's movement.

In professional wrestling, the term "rear naked choke" refers to a grounded version of the [[sleeper hold]] with body scissors applied. This variant is used by several wrestlers such as [[All Elite Wrestling]] and [i]Ring of Honor[/i] wrestler [[Samoa Joe]] (calling his RNC as the [i]Coquina Clutch[/i]), [[WWE]] wrestlers [[Gunther (WWE)|]] (as the [i]Gojira Clutch[/i]), and Shayna Baszler (as the [i]Kirifuda Clutch[/i]). WWE wrestler Karrion Kross does a modified version of the RNC which he calls as the [i]Kross Jacket[/i].  

In [[Judo]], the rear naked choke is known as Hadaka-jime, one of the 36 constriction techniques of Kodokan Judo

title: otoshidama
body:
A [[gift]] of [[money]] given to children on Japanese [[New Year]]'s Day.

Otoshidama tend to be given in white [[envelope]]s bound with a pink or red paper 'ribbon cord' (in [i]mizuhiki[/i] style). Often this "ribbon cord" may just be a pattern printed on the envelope. Money bills are usually folded in threes before being inserted.

The word "お年玉" (otoshidama) may sometimes be printed on the front of the envelope. This unambiguously identifies this as otoshidama (instead of [[hongbao]]). A less common word is "祝".

h4. Examples

* !post #1595291
* !post #1891823
* !post #2983502
* !post #3218197

h4. See also

* [[New Year]]
* [[hongbao]] [tn]Chinese equivalent. Often red. Almost never white (considered inauspicious).[/tn]

title: oak_cake_roll_(honkai:_star_rail)
body: A consumable in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. In-setting, the food item originated from a nutritional desperation among frontier settlers before evolving into a culinary tradition among the aristocratic classes. As such, the name is literal— elements from actual oak trees and other flora are baked into the cakes, presenting a formidable challenge for diners who order them. Usually associated with [[Firefly (Honkai: Star Rail)|]], who gets one every day in Penacony.

title: tifa_lockhart
body:

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[red eyes]], and famously [[large breasts]]. Her typical attire is a [[white tank top|white]] [[crop top|cropped]] [[tank top]] and a [[black skirt]] with [[suspenders]]. The remake adds a [[black shirt|black]] [[undershirt]] and [[black shorts]], as well as [[black thighhighs]] to her typical attire.

Voiced by Rachael Leigh Cook (pre-Remake) and Britt Baron (Remake) in English and Itou Ayumi in Japanese.

title: navy_seals
body:
The [b]United States Navy Sea, Air, and Land (SEAL) Teams[/b], also known as the [b]Navy Seals[/b], is the [[military operator|Special Forces]] of the [[United States Navy]]. 

Since its founding in January 1, 1962, the Navy SEALs have performed various special military operations for the United States military throughout the world.

The group became famous when one of it's Teams, [b]Naval Special Warfare Development Group[/b] (DEVGRU), unofficially known as [b]Seal Team 6[/b], the most elite force of the Navy SEALs, killed Al-Qaeda leader [[Osama bin Laden]] on May 2, 2011.

Unfortunately, due to the Seals new found fame, some former and current members have criticize some of their teammates, especially newer ones, of becoming rude and disrespectful to the chain of command, who are more interested of becoming famous rather than doing their duty and serving their country.

title: exia_repair
body:
[b]GN-001RE Gundam Exia Repair[/b]
A crudely fixed [[Gundam Exia]], kept in bare working order by [[setsuna f. seiei|Setsuna F. Seiei]] after the battles against [[Alejandro Corner]] and [[Graham Aker]]. Its left arm is missing, that part of the MS covered with a cloth, and the right side of its head is a makeshift graft from a Tieren, which gives it a right eye glowing red. Moreover, the right knee armor is gone, as is the left waist armor plate, and the GN Sword on its right arm is [[damaged|broken]], with only half of it stil there.

He's later revealed to be one of the "Four Emperors", world's four greatest pirates, along with "Whitebeard" [[Edward Newgate]], "Big Mom" [[Charlotte Linlin]] and "[[Kaidou (one piece)|]] of the Beasts".

title: hokuto_no_ken
body:
[b]Hokuto no Ken[/b] (known as [b]Fist of the North Star[/b] in the west) is a Japanese [[post-apocalypse|post-apocalyptic]] action manga series and media franchises illustrated by [[Hara Tetsuo]] and written by Buronson. The manga was first published in 1982 on [[Weekly Shounen Jump]].

The original anime adaptation created by [[Toei Animation]] in 1984 sparked a massive controversy due to the anime featured massive amount of violence (especially for its time when "Adult content air time" did not exist), most notably gore. leading to massive usage of censorship on the anime, and the creation of "Adult content air time", a slot of airing time on Television specifically for violent anime.

Nevertheless, the series' extreme violence and masculine-heavy theme had later inspired other action shounen and seinen manga and anime, particularly during late 80s and 90s era. Notable examples were [[jojo_no_kimyou_na_bouken|JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]], [[Grappler Baki]], [[Bastard!!]] [[Sun-Ken Rock]], [[Berserk]] and recently [[Chainsaw Man]] and [[Jujutsu Kaisen]].

Due to the unique [[manly]] artstyle, heavely inspired by 80s Movies like [[Mad Max]] and [[Terminator]], the show is also frequently subjected to various [[parody]] comedy doujins that were usually revolved around turning various cute anime girl into a "[[hara_tetsuo_(style)|K-style]]" style macho women (mostly involves the character [[cosplay]] and attempt to roleplay as their respective character) for comedic effect.

h5. Story (anime adaptation)

Near the end of the 20th century, a nuclear war engulfed most of the Earth's surface, reducing most of the world into a vast desert wasteland. The survivors of mankind banded together in tribes in order to fight over the few supply of uncontaminated food and water still left in the world, with the strong often preying on the weak. [[Kenshiro]], the successor of the assassination art known as Hokuto Shinken, wanders the wasteland after being separated from his fiancee [[Yuria (Hokuto no Ken)|]] by his friend-turned-enemy [[Shin_(hokuto_no_ken)|Shin]]. Accompanied by two young children, [[Bat (Hokuto no Ken)|]] and [[Lin (hokuto no ken)|]], Ken becomes a savior to the weak and innocent from the various gangs and ruthless bandits threatening their survival. Throughout the course of his journey, Kenshiro encounters various formidable rivals and adversaries, ultimately culminating with Kenshiro's eldest adoptive brother [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|]], an oppressive tyrant who challenges Ken for the right of the Hokuto Shinken succession.

Several years afterward, Kenshiro reunites with the now grown Bat and Lynn in order to stand up against a corrupt Imperial Army. The three, with the help of other rebels, manage to expose a conspiracy within the Imperial Army to keep the Heavenly Empress ([spoiler]Lynn's estranged twin sister, Lui[/spoiler]) imprisoned. The Empress is saved, only for Lynn to be taken to the "Land of Asura", a country of warriors where only the mightiest survive. Kenshiro crosses to Asura in pursuit of her, only to find himself fighting against the three generals who rule over the land. [spoiler]Kenshiro finds himself fighting not only against his own blood brother Hyou, but also [[Kaioh (hokuto no ken)|Kaioh]], Raoh's own brother.[/spoiler]

body:
[b]Rei[/b] ([b]レイ[/b]) is a character from [[Hokuto no Ken]].

He is the successor of Nanto Suichou Ken (南斗水鳥拳, "South Star Waterfowl Fist"), which is said to be the most elegant of the Nanto Seiken styles, and represents the Star of Justice (義星, Gi-sei). While away on training, his home village was attacked by a "Man with Seven Scars" (who was actually [[Jagi]] imposted as his brother [[Kenshiro]]), who killed Rei's parents and kidnapped his sister [[Airi_(hokuto_no_ken)|Airi]].

Rei later accompanied with [[Kenshiro]] in a quest to taking back his sister (who's later being sold as slave). After Jagi is defeated and knowing the truth about "Man with Seven Scars", Rei later became a close friend with Kenshiro and helped him in a quest to find his lost adopted brother, [[toki_(hokuto_no_ken)|Toki]].

h4. Known moves

* 南斗虎破龍 ([i]Nanto Ko Ha Ryuu[/i])
** Places the opponent in a temporary death-like coma. Rei's counterpart to [[Kenshiro]]'s [i]Hokuto Ryuu Geki Ko[/i].

* 飛燕流舞 ([i]Hien Ryubu[/i])
** An aerial technique that uses the air to slice through objects.

* 飛翔白麗 ([i][[Hishou Hakurei]][/i])
** The ultimate Suichou Ken technique. A jumping mid-air double stabbing attack. [spoiler]Used to kill [[Yuda_(hokuto_no_ken)|Juda]].[/spoiler]

* 断己相殺拳 ([i]Danko Sousai Ken[/i])
** The ultimate suicide technique that kills an opponent at the expense of the user. [spoiler]Attempted to used to kill [[Raoh_(hokuto_no_ken)|]].[/spoiler]

title: homelander
body: [b]Homelander[/b] (real name [b]John Gillman[/b]) is the main antagonist of the comic book series [[The Boys]], and one of the two posthumous overarching antagonists (alongside [[Black Noir]]) of it's sequel/spin-off miniseries The Boys: Dear Becky. He is also the leader of The Seven, one of the strongest Supes in the world, and the archenemy of [[Billy Butcher]], the leader of The Boys. He is essentially a psychopathic [[parody]] of [[Superman]]. He is also notorious for his tendency to spam his [[laser]] [[eye beam]] attacks. h4. See also * [[Omni-Man]] - similar hero-villain character * [[Homelander Power Scaling (meme)]] * [[Yummers (meme)]]

title: homelander_power_scaling_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] which originated from a 2024 Twitter debate about whether [[Homelander]] from [[The Boys]] or [[Sportacus]] from [[LazyTown]] was stronger.

After many pointed out that Sportacus was capable of numerous superhuman feats that far surpassed Homelander, the meme later evolved into a powerscaling fanart trend that involves pitting Homelander against Sportacus or other characters in a typically one-sided fight.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/homelander-vs-sportacus

title: leatherclub_scene_(meme)
body:
One of the most famous scenes in the [[Gachimuchi]] universe, which originally came from gay porn series "Lords of the Lockeroom" (the origin of the Gachimuchi universe).

In this scene, [[Van Darkholme]] walked into the [[locker room]] to change his outfit from his [[BDSM|leather]] outfit to exercise. [[Mark Wolff]], who was sitting on a [[bench]], mocked Van's leather outfit by saying "Hey buddy, I think you got the wrong door, the Leather club is two blocks down". Van  instantly replied "Fuck you", prompting Wolff to challenge Van to do gay pants wrestling and Van accepted his challenge.

title: gremlins_(film)
body:
A 1984 American fantasy comedy horror film directed by Joe Dante.

The story follows young man Billy Peltzer, who receives a strange creature as a pet, which then spawns other creatures that transform into aggressive imp-like monsters later known as "[[gremlin (mythology)|]]" that wreak havoc on Billy's town during [[Christmas]] Eve.

The film's depiction of gremlin has since codified the relatively new folklore creature into fantasy worldbuilding.

title: orc_eiyuu_monogatari
body:
Orc Eiyūden Monogatari ~Sontaku Retsuden~ (Orc Hero Story ~Biographical Conjecture~) is a 2019-to-present light novel series by Rifujin na Magonote (author of [[Mushoku Tensei]]).  The series began physical publication in 2020 and features illustrations by [[Asanagi]].  A manga adaption is in the works and the novels are published as Orc Eroica in English.

The series revolves around the [[orc]] hero [[Bash_(orc_eiyuu_monogatari)|]] who has set off on a journey as a representative of his race after the end of the great war between the 12 races. While being a representative of his race is the surface reason for Bash's journey, he has the ulterior motive of using this journey as a means to lose his virginity.

title: card_game
body:
A game played with [[card]]s as the main medium of interaction.

Card games were typically divided in two categories:

* [b]Collectible card game[/b] (CCG), a card game that utilize a fixed set of cards with little to no new cards added into the game, such as the classic [[playing card]]s and [[UNO (game)|]].
* [b]Trading card game [/b] (TCG), derived from [[trading card]]s, a card game that feature a wide variety of cards, with new cards being regularily added into the game. Notable examples including [[Magic: The Gathering]] and [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]]
other_names: トレーディングカードゲーム

title: m.u.g.e.n
body:
A "[[Fighting game]] engine" made by Elecbyte originally intended to be made into a run-and-gun game. When it was abandoned in 1999, modders turned it into an open-source fighting game with official fighting game characters and fanmade versions of many different characters.

Surprisingly, two characters were produced for M.U.G.E.N before its discontinuation: [[Kung Fu Man]] and [[Suave Dude]]. Both of these two characters became the base of the modders to create various new characters. 

After learning about their abandoned project being revived, Elecbyte briefly returned in September of 2009 with a new HD version of MUGEN available for download on its site.

This tag can be applied to various [[original]] M.U.G.E.N characters, either a completely original design or an [[alternate costume]] of an existing character.

title: helena_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the USS [i]Helena[/i] (CL-50). Character design by [[Realmbw]], voiced by Chuujou Tomoyo.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with a [[purple hair|purple]] inner shade and [[ahoge]], and [[purple eyes]]. As she was the only of the [i]Brooklyn[/i]-class that failed to survive the war, she has a shorter height than her sisters. 

Her outfit is the same as her sisters: a [[two-tone dress]] of white and Navy Blue with [[side slit|side openings]], black [[elbow gloves]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], [[black panties]], and [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her five historic 152 mm triple mounts in two separate hull pieces, one of which is used as a handgun. Her SG [[radar]] is visible as a [[hair ornament]], a reference to how she had historically been the first to detect inbound Japanese forces in the battles of Cape Esperance and Naval Guadalcanal and likewise reflects in her in-game skills. She also has a 28 mm quad [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount directly to her back.

She was torpedoed at the attack on Pearl Harbor in December 1941 and was repaired and modernized before returning to service in early 1942. She was sunk in the Battle of Kula Gulf on 6 July 1943.

title: hammer_and_sickle
body:
[b]The [[hammer]] and [[sickle]][/b] is a part of communist symbolism and its usage indicates an association with [[Communism]], a Communist party, or a Communist state. It symbolizes the unity of peasants and workers.

Although it is a universal symbol for communism, it is typically associated with the [[Soviet]] Union due to being the first country that adopted the symbol.

This tag is for the original hammer and sickle symbol, for various derivative or a parody of the symbol such as the [[pravda (emblem)|]] emblem, use their respective tags instead.

h4. See also

* [[Soviet flag]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hammer and sickle":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hammer_and_sickle

title: 2024_south_korea_martial_law_crisis
body:
On the night of 3 December, 2024, [[South Korea]]n president [[Yoon Suk-Yeol]] declared martial law to suspend the country's parliament. In his declaration, Yoon accused the opposition coalition, which has the majority in the National Assembly, of being involved in "anti-state activities".

In the ensuing events, the opposition coalition MPs voted to force the president to lift the martial law, and protests ensued to pressure Yoon to lift the martial law. After just 6 hours, president Yoon lifted the martial law after pressure from the South Korean public.

The event was generally described as a self-coup, as Yoon's approval ratings had significantly dropped before the event, along with facing various scandals. Yoon was later impeached on 14 December that year.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: 2024 South Korean martial law crisis":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_South_Korean_martial_law_crisis]

title: takarabune
body:
In [[japanese mythology|Japanese folklore]], the [b]Takarabune[/b] (宝船), or "Treasure Ship", is a mythical ship piloted through the heavens by the [[Seven Lucky Gods]] during the first three days of the [[New Year]]. A picture of the ship forms an essential part of traditional Japanese New Year celebrations.

(From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia)

h4. External links

"Takarabune on Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Takarabune]

title: left_4_dead
body:
A team-based first person [[zombie]] shooter first developed by Turtle Rock Studio before being acquired by [[Valve Software]] to also work on the game together. Set place in 2008 during a viral pandemic which turns people into mutated, violent monsters hellbent in attacking other uninfected humans.

The gameplay is focused on co-op with your team to get to safety at the end of each map. There is also a team-based versus mode where up to 8 players compete against each other in teams of 4, Survivors and Infected, to see who can get the most points to win.

Was followed up by [[Left 4 Dead 2]].

h4. External links
* Wikipedia entry: "Left 4 Dead":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Left_4_Dead]

title: ze_(phrase)
body:
ぜ

A particle in the Japanese language which adds emphasis and masculinity to a sentence.

It is frequently associated with [[Kirisame Marisa]], who commonly ends her sentences with ze, even when it doesn't make much grammatical sense.

This tag should [b]not[/b] be used any time the ze particle appears in a sentence. It should only be used when it is given some form of emphasis, such as when a speech bubble contains nothing but the word ze, or the word is written in romaji in the original text.

This tag replaces pool #1431: Touhou - Kirisame Marisa - ZE!

title: reisen_udongein_inaba
body:
The "Lunatic [[Moon Rabbit]]". Stage 5 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Imperishable Night]] and later a recurring playable character in games.

Pet lunar [[rabbit girl|rabbit]] of [[Houraisan Kaguya]], apprentice to [[Yagokoro Eirin]], and caretaker of earth-born rabbit youkai [[Inaba Tewi]]. Her power is to cause lunacy with her stare, as well as control all kinds of wavelengths. Ironically, Reisen is also depicted as one of the more level-headed characters of the series. Doujins make fun of her danmaku, which vaguely resemble suppositories, as well as her rabbit ears, which look as though they were buttoned onto her head. In [[Urban Legend in Limbo]], her urban legend was the [[Kune-kune]].
 
h4. Appearance
* !post #7885194: Usual Appearance
* !post #2789206: [[Urban Legend in Limbo]]

She has [[red eyes]], [[rabbit ears]] and a [[rabbit tail]], and [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]]. She is one of the few Touhou characters with a "normal" outfit, with a [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]] over a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] [[collared shirt|with]] a [[red necktie]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[pink skirt]], [[white socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. There might be a [[crescent pin]] or a [[carrot pin]] somewhere on her clothing. 

h4. External links
* "Touhou Wiki: Reisen Udongein Inaba":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Reisen_Udongein_Inaba
other_names: 鈴仙・優曇華院・イナバ

title: masuta_dexi
body:
A [[demon boy|demon]] [[gentleman]] [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] inhabiting a vessel, owner of Cafe Cavil and a member of [[World Connect]].
Designed by [[Lack]].

His costume consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[horned headwear|horned]] [[tophat]] paired with a [[black mask|black]] [[dot-matrix|dot-matrix mask]] that show his fiery [[glowing eyes]]. He dons a [[long coat|long]] [[open coat|open]] [[brown coat|brown]] with a [[plaid coat|plaid]] pattern along the bottom and [[flame print]] on his shoulders with [[black fire|black]] and [[fire|red flames]] surrounding him. Underneath he sports a [[buttons|buttoned]] [[red vest]] and [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] combo with a [[brown necktie|brown]] [[tie clip|necktie]]. title: ford_crown_victoria
body: A full-sized sedan manufactured by the [[Ford|Ford Motor Company]], the Crown Victoria was best known as the iconic [[police car]] (and [[taxi]]) for several decades. Built on Ford's Panther platform, shared with the [[Lincoln Town Car]] and Mercury Grand Marquis. Production of the entire line completely ceased in 2012 (with the Crown Victoria Police Interceptor having already been discontinued in 2011). Cars that replaced the Crown Vic in police fleets vary by city, some common replacements being the [[Dodge Charger]], [[Ford Taurus]], and [[Chevrolet Caprice]]. h4. Generations * !post #5204069: [[ford crown victoria (1st generation)|1st Generation]] (1991-1997) * !post #5093657: [[ford crown victoria (2nd generation)|2nd Generation]] (1998-2012)

title: sengoku_jidai
body:
A period of feudal [[Japan]] between around circa 1450 to 1600 in which the country was divided among various clans of warlords who fought for dominance over the others, following the decline of the Ashikaga Shogunate at the end of the [[Nanboku-chou Jidai]].

The period reached its climax around 1540 when the "three great unifiers" of Japan emerged; [[Oda Nobunaga]] who managed to unify Japan by force before being forced to commit suicide after being betrayed by [[Akechi Mitsuhide]], [[Toyotomi Hideyoshi]], Nobunaga's retainer who revenged his master by killing Mitsuhide and unify Japan, before faced his downfall after a failed invasion of Korea in 1598, and [[Tokugawa Ieyasu]], another of the Nobunaga's retainer who waited for an opportunity and seized all of remnants of Toyotomi and Oda clans and finally unified the country after the [[battle of Sekigahara]]. 

The era ended with Japan being united under the leadership of the Tokugawa shogunate who closed the country and started the [[Edo Jidai|Edo period]]. Due to being one of the most prevalent era in Japanese history, several media franchises have emerged based on it. It also has influenced various media works in the country.

h4. See also

* [[Samurai]]

title: honoka_(doa)
body:
A high school student and martial artist who made her debut in the 2015 title [[Dead or Alive 5]].

She has [[pink eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] to [[medium hair|medium length]] [[pink hair]] stylized with a [[one side up]] & [[bangs]]. Usually wears a [[skull hair ornament]]. Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[blazer]], [[red necktie]], [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black glove]], [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white legwear|white]] [[thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. She has the [[large breasts|largest breast size]] out of all DOA characters, not counting [[Nicole 458]].

Honoka bears a strong resemblance to [[Kosaka Honoka]] from the anime television series, [[Love Live!]]

In December 2020, she received the skin [[Honoka (Summer Angel on the Shore) (DoA)|]] as part of a collab with [[Azur Lane]].

title: fk_crvena_zvezda
body:
[B]Fudbalski klub Crvena zvezda[/b] (Football Club Red Star), otherwise colloqually referred to internationally as Red Star Belgrade, is a Serbian professional football club based in Belgrade, and a member of the Red Star multi-sport club. It is the most successful club from Southeastern Europe, and the most popular football club in Serbia. Their eternal rivals are fellow Belgrade football club Partizan, engaged in one of Europe's fiercest derbies.

In Japan, the club is well-known for winning the 1991 Intercontinental Cup, whose final match was played in Tokyo (which in Serbia prompted the slogan 'Srbija do Tokija' [Serbia to Tokyo], due to winning the European Cup that year in Italy as well); its most well-known member in Japan is [[Dragan Stojkovic Piksi|Dragan Stojković "Piksi"]], who signed with [[Nagoya Grampus]] and would later coach for the team after retirement.

h4. External links

* Twitter: "FKツルヴェナ ズヴェズダ":https://twitter.com/crvenazvezda_jp

title: genryuusai_maki
body:
[b]Genryuusai Maki[/b], more commonly known simply as [b]Maki[/b], is a character in the [[Final Fight]] and [[Street Fighter]] series, who originally appeared in the [[Super Nintendo]] beat 'em up Final Fight 2 as one of the game's main characters. 

Maki is a blond-haired red-clad female ninja who happens to be the younger sister of Guy's fiancee Rena. Like [[Guy (final fight)|]], Maki is also trained in the Bushin style of ninjutsu and uses many of the same abilities and techniques.

Maki was well received by critics and fans alike, becoming one of the most popular Street Fighter characters despite appearing only in [[Capcom vs SNK 2]] and portable versions of [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|Street Fighter Alpha 3]].

title: guy_(final_fight)
body:
[b]Guy[/b] is a video game character in both the [[Final Fight]] and [[Street Fighter]] series by [[Capcom]]. 

He first appeared in the 1989 beat 'em up Final Fight and later appeared in the [i]Street Fighter Alpha[/i] series. 

Guy is a red-clad ninpō master of Japanese descent who has been taught the special Bushin form of [[ninjutsu]].

According to Capcom's original arcade production staff, Guy's original design was based on "Guy Picciotto":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guy_Picciotto , the former vocalist of the late 80s post-hardcore punk rock band "Fugazi":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fugazi . Like his video game counterpart, Picciotto was known for his fondness to wear orange shirts and [[converse]] sneaker shoes during concerts.

h4. See also

* [[Genryuusai Maki]]

title: chinese_zodiac
body:
The Shēngxiào (Chinese: 生肖), better known in English as the Chinese Zodiac, is a scheme that relates each year to an animal and its reputed attributes, which, combined with the 5 Chinese elements (fire, water, earth, wood, metal), creates a 60-year cycle. 

Unlike the Western [[zodiac]], it has no relation to the constellations on the ecliptic.

Many other Asian countries have adopted the Chinese Zodiac as well, sometimes with slight changes ("see below":#dtext-variants).

This tag is automatically applied when the image reference at least one of the Chinese Zodiac, such as various [[New Year]] arts.

[table]
  [thead]
    [tr]
      [th colspan="5" align="center"]The Twelve Zodiacs[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr align="center"]
      [th]Animal[/th]
      [th]Romanized (Ch.)[/th]
      [th]Chinese (Trad.)[/th]
      [th]Chinese (Sim.)[/th]
      [th]Earthly Branch[/th]
    [/tr]
  [/thead]
  [tbody]
    [tr]
      [td align="left"][[year of the rat|Rat]][/td]
      [td align="center"]Shǔ[/td]
      [td align="center"]鼠[/td]
      [td align="right"][/td]
      [td align="center"]子[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
      [td align="left"][[year of the ox|Ox]][/td]
      [td align="center"]Niú[/td]
      [td align="center"]牛[/td]
      [td align="right"][/td]
      [td align="center"]丑[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
      [td align="left"][[year of the tiger|Tiger]][/td]
      [td align="center"]Hǔ[/td]
      [td align="center"]虎[/td]
      [td align="right"][/td]
      [td align="center"]寅[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
      [td align="left"][[year of the Rabbit|Rabbit]][/td]
      [td align="center"]Tù[/td]
      [td align="center"]兔[/td]
      [td align="right"][/td]
      [td align="center"]卯 [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
      [td align="left"][[year of the Dragon|Dragon]][/td]
      [td align="center"]Lóng[/td]
      [td align="center"]龍[/td]
      [td align="right"]龙[/td]
      [td align="center"]辰[/td]
    [/tr]

title: mega_man_battle_network_(series)
body:
Mega Man Battle Network (known in Japan as [b]Rockman EXE[/b]) is a spin off series of [[Mega Man (series)|]] set in the year 200x.  The series spans six games across the [[Game Boy Advance]] (with Mega Man Battle Network 5 also appearing on the [[Nintendo DS]]).  Players control Lan Hikari outside of the game's net world.  When it's time to jack into the net and bust [[virus (mega man)|viruses]], Lan can do so by using his [[NetNavi]] MegaMan.EXE contained in a device called the PET ([[Personal Terminal]]).

Much of the gameplay resembles older Mega Man games as players can defeat bosses and viruses to acquire their "Chip" data and use them as attacks as they see fit.  While in the net world, players will control MegaMan.EXE while busting viruses and protecting the web from villains ranging from the classic [[Lord Wily (mega man)|Wily]] to hellbent corporations such as Gospel, along with new faces such as [[Dr. Regal (mega man)|]].

After the series' sixth and final game, the Mega Man metaseries developed yet another spin off game in the form of [[Mega Man Star Force (series)|]].


h4. Characters

title: toutetsu_yuuma
body: [b] Undefeated Matriarch of the Gouyoku Alliance [/b] Toutetsu Yuuma is the main antagonist and final boss of [[Touhou]] 17.5, [[sunken fossil world|Gouyoku Ibun ~ Suibotsushita Chinshuu Jigoku (Strange Tale of Avarice ~ Submerged Hell of Sunken Sorrow)]], first mentioned in Wily Beast and Weakest Creature. In [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]], she is revealed to have once been friends with [[Yakumo Ran|Ran]]. As her title suggests, she's the boss of the [[Eagle Spirit (touhou)|]]s. She has large [[red horns|red]], [[sheep horns]], with a [[horn ribbon]] on both horns. She has [[curly hair|curly]], [[white hair]], [[red eyes]] with [[horizontal pupils|horizontal]], [[rectangular pupils]], and is often depicted with [[sharp teeth]]. She wears [[earrings]] on her [[pointy ears]]. She wears a [[blue dress]] with [[detached_sleeves|detached]], [[red sleeves]]. Her clothing has a [[meandros]] [[patterned clothing|pattern]] with [[eye print]]s. Some artists may depict her wearing a [[blue vest]] and [[blue skirt]] instead. She often goes [[barefoot]] and [[holding spork|carries around]] an [[oversized object|oversized]] [[spork]] which may be filled with [[motor oil]] or [[blood]]. Her spork may be depicted as a [[spoon]] by some artists, either deliberately or as a mistake. Her ability allows her to devour and absorb almost absolutely anything, turning it into her power. Unlike her fellow Animal Realm matriarchs, she and her organization prefer to avoid pointless conflict, and would rather recruit or forge a mutually-beneficial relationship with their enemies, with an all-out war being a last resort for them. Taking advantage of the events in Wily Beast and Weakest Creature, she went to the Former Hell of Blood Pools in order to monopolize the petroleum deposits there, containing the desires of long dead organic beings. Note: If you can't concretely identify the utensil she is wielding (even with the tags/title/commentary/parent-child posts/pools), just tag [[utensil]] instead. h4. See also * [[Imaginary Toutetsu]] h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Yuuma Toutetsu":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Yuuma_Toutetsu

title: emiya_kiritsugu_(assassin)
body:
Assassin-class Servant from [i][[Fate/Grand Order]][/i].

He's [[Emiya Kiritsugu]] from a universe where the Einzbern House has not adopted the strategy of hiring an outside Master, making him not meet with the [[Irisviel von Einzbern|wife]] he was supposed to meet, and thus was neither separated from said wife nor suffered the frustration of such a separation. Yet, he still became a cold blooded assassin.

Has white hair, tanned skin, and often conceals his face with bandages and hood. Attacks using throwing daggers, a combat knife and his trademark firearms (Thompson Contender and Calico M950). Uses the Emiya crest and magecraft for his Noble Phantasm, Chronos Rose.

title: belial_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character. Voiced by [[Hosoya Yoshimasa]].

The fallen angel of cunning plays fast and loose with his tongue, condemning the world at one moment, extolling the sanctity of life the next. Watch him run his fingers down the supple stem of a flower, snap it in twain, and waltz across a stage garnished with skydwellers' viscera. Look into the abyss of his heart, and what does one find? A feeling of insecure narcissism, or is it altruistic benevolence? Belial numbered among the first primal beasts to be brought into existence. Now a fallen angel known as the Serpent, he remains as devoted to his creator, [[lucilius_(granblue_fantasy)|Lucilius]], as he was millennia ago. [spoiler]  He instigated the Primarch rebellions as part of Lucilius' schemes. "000" reveals that his loyalties have carried over 2000 years, having used [[lucifer_(shingeki_no_bahamut)|Lucifer]]'s body to revive Lucilius to help the Astral finally witness the end of the world. [/spoiler]

Belial was revealed as a Character Pass Season 1 DLC character in [[Granblue Fantasy Versus]] on December 14, 2019, as part of a villains pack alongside Beelzebub. He was later carried over to [[Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising]], along with the other prior DLC characters.

[B]Chako[/b] is a female farmer that is encountered early in [[Dragon Quest Builders 2]]. She was renamed to [b]Rosie[/b] in the English localization.

Notably, she bears a resemblance to [[Norimaki Arale]] from [[Dr. Slump]], albeit with [[aqua hair]] instead of purple. This may be intentional, considering that [[Toriyama Akira]] created some (if not all) of the character designs in the game.

title: helel_ben_sahar_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Granblue Fantasy]] character. One of [[Bahamut_(shingeki_no_bahamut)|]]'s Speakers.

[spoiler] Created by the Omnipotent as a Speaker, their servant, he was given the name Helel ben Sahar and was tasked with spreading the Omnipotent's words and their will among the people of the realm they created. He chose not to interfere in his master's conflict with ancient humans even after it resulted in the splitting of the Omnipotent into two conflicting and opposed sides; the god of the skies and the god of the stars. The sky god wished to recreate the sky realm while the Astral god opted to leave and create an entirely new world based on the one they had left, neither paying attention to the fate of the Speaker. Still, he continued to await contact from his master so he might continue fulfilling his role as Speaker. For thousands of years he took on the role of observer, watching over the two realms as they changed and evolved, acting only to deal with threats outwith the gods' powers.

Sensing an upcoming calamity that could befall the sky realm and wishing to protect the world his master created and its inhabitants, he decided to join the Singularity, the only known living human with the power to alter course of fate itself, assuming a new name to hide his true identity as a god's servant - Lucio.

In time the predicted calamity was revealed to have been set in motion by [[lucilius_(granblue_fantasy)|Lucilius]], who wished to bring an end to the entire sky realm. Initially Lucio tried to convince Lucilius to abandon his plan and his rebellion against gods, hoping to reach some common understanding as Lucilius was an Astral created in Lucio's image. But negotiations failed and Lucio was forced to feign being defeated by Lucilius, waiting inside the latter's core for the right moment to trap Lucilius in a space between dimensions which would serve as an eternal prison.

After the calamity was halted and the visible threat was dealt with, he started to wonder if he still needed to perform his duties and if his master's wishes could really be good for this world. After all, it was not only the power of Supreme Primarch that saved the world but the combined strength of many different forces. He started to wonder if perhaps the world's current state was already perfect and no longer in need of evolution thanks to living creatures and their ability to support each other and compensate their own weaknesses. He confronted the Singularity with these mixed feelings in a dream. After reaffirming himself in his new stance, he left his role as observer and decided that it was fine to simply continue living on and to use his powers for the well-being of the skies. Aboard the Grandcypher alongside Singularity and their crew, he waits for the day when he can ask his master the true purpose behind himself, the world, and all living beings. [/spoiler]

For his other other identity, see [[Lucio (granblue fantasy)|]].

title: lucio_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character. Voiced by [[Sakurai Takahiro]].

The beautiful young man, surrounded by a divine aura, introduced himself as a "former stage actor" when he appeared before the crew. He is very gentle and dislikes conflicts. However, since he does not understand the subtleties of other people's emotions very well, his heart grieves at the sight of people fighting, especially if it's because of his beautiful face. He has profound knowledge about the bottom of the sky - another world called the "Crimson Horizon". [spoiler]He is the true identity of [[helel_ben_sahar_(granblue_fantasy)|Helel ben Sahar]].[/spoiler]

h4. Profile

h4. Official Alternate Costumes
Shares a striking resemblance with the supreme primarch [[lucifer_(Shingeki no Bahamut)|Lucifer]] and the Astral researcher [[Lucilius_(Granblue Fantasy)|Lucilius]]. To avoid any mistaken tagging, you can rely on the following contextual cues: Lucifer is frequently paired with [[Sandalphon_(granblue_fantasy)|Sandalphon]] and features [six pairs of wings](https://gbf.wiki/images/1/1e/Npc_zoom_3990190000_01.png), while Lucio, often seen in his [summer outfit](https://gbf.wiki/images/9/9e/Npc_zoom_3040286000_01.png), has [two pairs of wings](https://gbf.wiki/images/d/d6/Npc_zoom_3040106000_01.png). Lucilius is typically depicted wearing either his [https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/vsbattles/images/8/87/Astral_Researcher.png/revision/latest?cb=20190629090002](astral robes) or his [https://gbf.wiki/images/d/d6/Npc_zoom_3991054000_01.png](Raid Boss) attire.

title: lucifer_(shingeki_no_bahamut)
body:
[[Shingeki no Bahamut]] and [[Granblue Fantasy]] character. Voiced by [[Sakurai Takahiro]] in Japanese.

One of the very first primal beasts ever created, he is known as the supreme primarch who commands all other archangels. He was made to oversee evolution by an [[lucilius_(granblue_fantasy)|Astral researcher]] who had a keen interest in the subject. Bequeathed with ultimate power by the Astrals, he strives to protect the people of the Sky Realm. Even now, his eyes—melancholic and unsuited to an ultimate weapon—scan the blue horizon, in search of anything that might disturb the progress of the skies. Originally just a Shingeki no Bahamut collaboration summon, he becomes an important recurring character in the "What Makes the Sky Blue" storyline.

[spoilers]Lucifer is credited as the creator of the archangels [[sandalphon_(granblue_fantasy)|Sandalphon]] and [[raziel_(granblue_fantasy)|Raziel]]. He and [[belial_(granblue_fantasy)|Belial]] were Lucilius' first creations and were created at the same time. In What Makes the Sky Blue II: Paradise Lost, he is decapitated by [[beelzebub_(granblue_fantasy)|Beelzebub]] so that he and Belial can harvest his body and use it to resurrect Lucillius. Overwhelmed with grief and anger, Sandalphon initially struggles with the loss but ultimately resolves to honor Lucifer's legacy. Sandalphon ascends to become the new supreme primarch, taking on the responsibilities and burden of leadership to protect the skies as Lucifer once did.[/spoilers]

Lucifer shares a similar appearance with Lucilius and is identical to [[lucio_(granblue_fantasy)|Lucio]] in both face and clothing, making differentiation challenging. Lucifer wears a short-sleeved [[breastplate]] with [[shoulder armor]], [[elbow gloves]], a thin red cloth around his neck, and a [[white cape]]. Unlike Lucio, who has two small wings, Lucifer has [[multiple_wings|six]] large [[feathered_wings|feathered]] [[white wings]]. Without wings, their personalities offer clues: Lucio appears teasing, while Lucifer is more innocent and joyous. Sandalphon is often annoyed by Lucio but blushes or appears delighted around Lucifer. Most [[yaoi|ship art]] featuring Sandalphon pairs him with Lucifer unless explicitly indicated otherwise.
other_names: ルシフェル(神撃のバハムート)

title: top_gear
body:
A [[BBC (broadcaster)|]] motoring show that became famous not only in Britain but also internationally and includes discussions, races, interviews, car challenges and a variety of other segments. Its most famous period and the inspiration for most works on this site referencing the series are when  [[Jeremy Clarkson]], [[James May]] and [[Richard Hammond]] presented a reworked version of the show from Series 1 in 2002 to Series 22 in 2015. Another well known character from [i]Top Gear[/i] is the  [[The Stig]], played by a number of anonymous race drivers.

The show was briefly cancelled in 2015 after Jeremy Clarkson was fired from the BBC for punching a producer, with Hammond and May leaving soon after. However, due to its popularity, they would be hired by [[Amazon (company)|]] for a new show called [[The Grand Tour]], which followed the same format.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia article: Top Gear (2002 TV series)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Top_Gear_(2002_TV_series)]

title: lucilius_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character. Voiced by [[Sakurai Takahiro]] in Japanese and [[Sean Chiplock]] in English.

Introduced as ??? in the first part of the event "What Makes the Sky Blue", Lucilius is later revealed in the second part to be an Astral and the creator of the first Primal Beasts, Supreme Primarch Lucifer and his adjutant [[Belial_(granblue_fantasy)|Belial]]. 

This Astral was the head researcher of a research lab. His unequivocal genius and transcendent will led to many breakthroughs that would shake up the world—notably the birth of the original primal beasts. But as his research into evolution progressed, he drew his own conclusions about the gods' designs and established the fallen angels to bring about his grand finale—a plan intended to destroy the world. Though rarely moved by emotion, he harbors a centuries-old hatred for the gods, seeing them as tyrants who imposed order on the boundless universe. For him, there is only one state of true freedom—nothingness.

On December 2, 2023, he was revealed as a boss in the story mode of [[Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising]] and later joined the playable roster as the first DLC character on January 16, 2024. Later, it was announced on January 11, 2024 that he would appear as an optional post-game boss in [[Granblue Fantasy Relink]], debuting in the game on March 14, 2024.

h4. Profile

h4.Official Alternate Costumes
In Granblue Fantasy, Lucilius, [[lucifer_(shingeki_no_bahamut)|Lucifer]], and [[lucio_(granblue_fantasy)|Lucio]] share identical facial features, making them distinguishable only by clothing and context. Lucilius, in his "Raid Boss":https://gbf.wiki/Lucilius_(NPC) form, is characterized by a [[stitched_neck|stitched neck scar]], black metallic curves on his chest and waist, [[topless_male|no shirt]], a [[torn_cape|torn]] [[red cape]], [[asymmetrical arms]], and [[armored_boots|armored]] [[thigh boots]]. In his "Astral Researcher":https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/vsbattles/images/8/87/Astral_Researcher.png/revision/latest?cb=20190629090002 form, he wears an [[oversized_clothes|oversized]] [[white robe]] with a [[hood]], a [[turtleneck]], and occasionally carries a [[holding_staff|staff]]. He typically has a [[expressionless|cold expression]] and is frequently seen with Belial.

title: sandalphon_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character. Voiced by [[suzumura_ken'ichi|Suzumura Ken'ichi]] in Japanese and Howard Wang in English.

Having arisen from a deep, long slumber, this archangel has inherited the will of the supreme primarch, [[lucifer_(shingeki_no_bahamut)|Lucifer]]. Though [[sandalphon_(granblue_fantasy)|Sandalphon]] previously had no role to play, he now bears the burden of carrying out vengeance in hopes of fulfilling a promise. Debuting as the central antagonist of the event "What Makes The Sky Blue" in 2017, [[sandalphon_(granblue_fantasy)|Sandalphon]] was originally intended as a simple one-off villain for an anniversary event. His popularity with the players, however, caused Cygames to turn WMTSB into a trilogy of events, with him starring in both the second and third parts, being recruitable in both.

He has gained several alternate forms due to his popularity, including a [https://gbf.wiki/Sandalphon_(Summer)](Water Summer) version in 2019, an [https://gbf.wiki/Sandalphon_(Earth_Grand)](Earth Grand) version in 2020, a [https://gbf.wiki/Sandalphon_(Valentine)](Wind Valentines) version in 2023, and a [https://gbf.wiki/Sandalphon](Light Grand) version in 2024. Currently, he is the only playable character to possess two distinct Grand forms. 

During the 10th Anniversary stream, it was revealed that he would join the roster of playable characters in [[granblue_fantasy:_relink|Granblue Fantasy: Relink]] in May 2024. Later, during EVO 2024, it was announced that he would also be added to [[granblue_fantasy_versus:_rising|Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising]] as part of Character Pass Season 2 in 2025.

title: roland_(project_moon)
body:
One of [[Library of Ruina]]'s main characters.

Based off of the 11th century poem "Song of Roland":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Song_of_Roland], with further inspiration from the 15th and 16th century epic poems "Orland Innamorato":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orlando_Innamorato and "Orlando Furioso":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orlando_Furioso. He differs from his inspirations by being married to [[Angelica (project moon)|]].

He wears intentionally basic clothes, consisting of a [[suit]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] and [[black necktie]]. Before his arrival to the Library, he wore a [[black mask]] that blocked people's perception of who he was.

title: angelica_(project_moon)
body:
[[Library of Ruina]] character, married to [[Roland (project moon)|]].
Based off of "Angelica":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angelica_(character) from the 15th and 16th century epic poems "Orland Innamorato":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orlando_Innamorato and "Orlando Furioso":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orlando_Furioso.

She wears a [[black jacket]] with [[black sweater|black]] [[turtleneck sweater]], a [[ring necklace]], [[black pants]], and a pair of [[black gloves]] [Spoiler] which she uses to store her arsenal of weapons and create an area of silence around her, giving her the title of the Black Silence[/spoiler]

[Spoiler][[Angelica (project moon)|]] and her brother [[Argalia (project moon)|]] are both Colour fixers, the Black Silence and Blue Reverberation respectively.
She and her unborn child perished before the game's events to [[The Pianist (project moon)|]], kick-starting the game's entire plot. Her death caused [[Roland (project moon)|]] to inherit her title of the Black Silence and rampage through the city in a vain attempt to get revenge on the one responsible for her death while her brother [[Argalia (project moon)|]] was driven insane by her death and distorted.[/spoiler]
