body:
[b]Shizuka Rin[/b] is a [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual Youtuber|]], part of the inaugural batch of eight. Designed by [[Takehana Note]].

title: mega_man_(series)
body:

h4. Games

* [[Mega Man Zero (series)|]]
* [[Mega Man Star Force (series)|]] [tn]([i]Shooting Star Rockman[/i] in Japan)[/tn]
* [[Mega Man ZX]] & [[Mega Man ZX Advent]]

h6. Other Games

* [[Pachislot Rockman Ability]], a pachislot Mega Man game.

h6. Adaptations

* [[Mega Man Battle Network (anime)]] (Mega Man NT Warrior)

h4. See also

title: siege_(arknights)
body:
[i]Siege, leader of the Glasgow Gang, will carve a path for you[/i]

A playable Vanguard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: [spoiler]Alexandrina Victoria[/spoiler]

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]July 10[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Aslan[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]172 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Also known as Vina, the leader of the Glasgow Gang, a squad full of former Londinium street punks which were forced to come to the Island. Her natural command, courage, and composure on the battlefield have made her one of the best operators employed by Rhodes Island. Her choice of weapon is a hammer.

[spoilers]Her real name is Alexandrina Victoria and she is the heir of the Aslan kings to the throne of Victoria. After the assassination of her father, she hid herself in the slums of Londinium where she became the leader of the Glasgow Gang, but she had to flee her homeland along with her entourage and seek refuge at Rhodes Island.

During the Victorian civil war, she returned to Londinium to help the people in need.[/spoilers]

Her characteristics draw many parallels to [[Saber (fate)|]] from the Fate series. Both characters share the same voice actress, have the same animal motifs (lions), and are affiliated with the United Kingdom (the Kingdom of Victoria in Arknights being heavily based on the UK).

She has [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], [[lion ears]] and a [[lion tail]]. She wears [[red_shorts|red]] [[short shorts]], a [[white tank top]], [[black jacket|black]] [[leather jacket]] and [[studded choker]].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Kawasumi Ayako]] (Japanese), Shuang Liang (Chinese), Claudia Jolly (English), and Gabin (Korean). Her art designer is [[Infukun]].

title: steven_spielberg
body: Steven Allan Spielberg (/ˈspiːlbɜːrɡ/; born December 18, 1946) is an American filmmaker. A major figure of the New Hollywood era and pioneer of the modern blockbuster, Spielberg is widely regarded as one of the greatest film directors of all time and is the most commercially successful director in film history. Among other accolades, he has received three Academy Awards, two BAFTA Awards, and four Golden Globe Awards as well as the AFI Life Achievement Award in 1995, the Knight Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire in 2001, the Kennedy Center Honor in 2006, the Cecil B. DeMille Award in 2009 and the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 2015. Seven of his films have been inducted into the National Film Registry by the Library of Congress as "culturally, historically or aesthetically significant".
other_names: スティーヴン・スピルバーグ

title: death_note_(2017)
body: Death Note is a 2017 American supernatural crime thriller film directed by Adam Wingard from a screenplay by Charles Parlapanides, Vlas Parlapanides, and Jeremy Slater, loosely based on [[death note|the manga of the same name]] by Tsugumi Ohba and Takeshi Obata. It stars Nat Wolff, LaKeith Stanfield, Margaret Qualley, Shea Whigham, Paul Nakauchi, Jason Liles, and [[Willem Dafoe]]. The plot follows an American high school student named [[Light Turner]] (portrayed by Wolff), who finds a mysterious supernatural notebook known as the [[Death Note (object)|]] and uses it to murder criminals around the globe under the alias of Kira, while an international detective known only as L (portrayed by Stanfield) seeks to find and arrest him.

title: las_leyendas
body: Leyendas is an animated horror-comedy film franchise created by Ricardo Arnaiz and produced by [[mexico|Mexican]] animation studio Ánima Estudios. It is loosely based on The Reluctant Dragon by Kenneth Grahame. It consists of seven films, a digital television series, and a mobile game. It centers on Leo San Juan, a heroic preteen boy who can communicate with ghosts and monsters; Theodora, a sassy and quirky preteen ghost girl with a know-it-all personality; Sir Andrés, an amicable but loony old knight; Alebrije, a mild-mannered mythological creature; and Finney and Morybetta, two silent calavera children.Set in the early nineteenth century, each of the films is based upon a different Mexican legend.

title: seiken_densetsu_1
body:
First game in the [[Seiken Densetsu]] RPG series, originally for the [[Game Boy]]. Released as [i]Final Fantasy Adventure[/i] in North America and [i]Mystic Quest[/i] in Europe.

Later remade for the [[Game Boy Advance]] under the title [i]Sword of Mana[/i]. The remake features distinctly different character designs.

Unlike later games in the franchise, the game features only one playable character, but certain allies (only one at a time) can join and help throughout the game.

h4. Characters

title: red_shoes_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

A member of Old Tales squad, alongside [[Cinderella (nikke)|]], [[Little Mermaid (nikke)|]], [[Hansel (nikke)|]] and [[Gretel (nikke)|]]. She and her squad constitute as the successors of the legendary [[Goddess (nikke)|]] squad, having modifications rivaling if not exceeding that of the aforementioned squad.

[spoiler]It was later revealed that Red Shoes is a traitor who was responsible for refining the Corruption code which the [[Rapture (nikke)|]]s use to corrupt Nikkes. Her primary motive for her treason is to gain coexistence with the Raptures. She specifically targeted Cinderella because she was considered the most powerful Nikke in the squad, and is directly responsible for Cinderella's corruption into the [[Heretics (nikke)|Heretic]] "Anachiro", resulting in humanity's defeat against the Raptures.

After her death, the Raptures took her eponymous legwear and Corruption code, implying that they only wanted her weaponry.[/spoiler]

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]], [[orange eyes]] and [[huge breasts]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white leotard]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[armored boots]].
other_names: レッドシューズ(勝利の女神:NIKKE)

title: i'm_not_gonna_sugarcoat_it_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] predominantly associated with [[fighting_game|fighting games]], where a portrait of a character is shown alongside one of their inputs for an effective attack, such as one that deals high amounts of damage while the opponent is unable to counter. The meme originated from the [[Tekken]] fandom and is associated with [[mishima_kazuya|Kazuya]].

title: sketch
body:
A hasty or undetailed drawing or painting often made as a preliminary study. Traits include rough lines, [[monochrome]] or basic coloring, and left over structural shapes.

Not all pictures with these traits are considered sketches, such as post #2721361 and post #2722170. Posts with proper use of the sketch tag are post #2720851 and post #2722791.

Abbreviated on Pixiv as "rkgk", which comes from the Japanese word for sketch (落書き, [i]rakugaki[/i]). Not all pictured tagged as "sketch" by the artist should be tagged as [[sketch]] on Danbooru. The picture must look like a sketch for it to apply. [b]Translated tags have been removed from this wiki, because artists tend to use this tag in a very misleading way.[/b]

Sketches are not sufficient reasons for flagging. See [[howto:flag]].

Not to be confused with [[sketching]], which is used for when a character within the image is sketching an image themselves.

h4. See also
* [[oekaki]]
* [[squiggle]]
* [[unfinished]]

title: eldritch_abomination
body:
The Eldritch Abomination is a type of creature defined by their complete disregard for the natural laws of the universe as we understand them and the love for body horror. Their physical form (if they even have one) is so bizarre, it even can make someone mad just by looking it. All Lovecraftian Horrors ([[Cthulhu]], [[Hastur]], [[Nyarlathotep]] etc.) are of this type.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Lovecraft":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H._P._Lovecraft

* "Wikipedia: Lovecraftian Horror":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lovecraftian_horror

title: restless_armour
body:
The [b]Restless Armour[/b] is a type of [[monster]] featured in the [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i] series. They resemble [[knight]]s and lack faces.

h6. Notable Restless Armour characters:
* [[Pisaro Knight]]
* [[cecily_(dqt)|Cecily]]

title: pisaro_knight
body:
The [b]Pisaro Knight[/b] is a male [[Restless Armour]] that appears in [i][[Dragon Quest IV]][/i] as a member of [[Pisaro]]'s army. He wears [[green armor]], differentiating him from other Restless Armours. In the English localization of IV, he is referred to as [b]Sir Roseguardin[/b] or just [b]Roseguardin[/b]. 

In [i][[Dragon Quest Monsters 3]][/i], which takes place in an [[alternate universe]] to IV, he is referred to as [b]Percival[/b].

body: [B]Cecily[/b] is a female [[Restless Armour]] that works as a receptionist in [i][[Dragon Quest Treasures]][/i]. Notably, she has [[pink armour]] and [[white flower]]s painted on one of the pauldrons.

title: mechanical_buddy_universe
body:
[[post-apocalypse|Post-apocalyptic]] science fiction setting by [[Ishiyumi]] (AKA Katou Takuji). Most stories in the setting generally involve a human paired off with a sapient robot character as their primary protagonists.

Four main stories are set in this universe:

* "The Story of a Droid":[/pools/16987]
* "Hawkeye in Love":[/pools/17005] 
* "The Banshee Cometh":[/pools/17015] 
* "Maid Would Want to Protect Her Lady":[/pools/17016]

In addition there are the side stories "The Story of an Manga Artist":[/pools/17081], and "Apparition":[/pools/17021] which technically takes place in the same universe.

Currently serialized by Square Enix as [b]Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0[/b].

h4. External links

* "Manga UP!: Mechanical Buddy Universe":https://global.manga-up.com/manga/234
* "Square Enix: Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0":https://magazine.jp.square-enix.com/yg/introduction/meka/
other_names: メカニカルバディユニバース

title: miyamoto_musashi_(swimsuit_berserker)_(fate)_(cosplay)
suzuran_(arknights)
body:
[i]Suzuran, Rhodes Island Operator, has nine times the strength, and the fluffiness.[/i]

A playable Supporter Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Lisa

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Higashi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]October 9[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Vulpo[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]137 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A child prodigy under the guidance of [[Kal'tsit (Arknights)|]] while receiving treatment at Rhodes Island. After she decided to apply to Rhodes Island, she was approved to participate in some low-difficulty tasks under the supervision of other operators.

One of the protagonists of the side story event [i]Twilight of Wolumonde[/i].

Her motif is based on the mythical [[kyuubi|nine-tailed]] [[kitsune|fox]]. Her callsign is [[object namesake|derived]] from the Japanese name of the flower, [i][[lily of the valley]][/i]. Her mother is [[Vulpisfoglia (Arknights)|Vulpisfoglia]].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Hondo Kaede]]. Her illustrator is [[sho_(sho_lwlw)|]].

h4. Skins

* !asset #24345630: [[Suzuran (yukibare) (arknights)|Yukibare]]

title: kal'tsit_(arknights)
body:
[i]Rhodes Island Medical Department Officer-in-Charge, Kal'tsit.[/i]

A playable Medic Operator character in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Rhodes Island[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]Undisclosed[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Feline[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]169 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]3 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Kal'tsit was a playable character during the beta testing of Arknights, but was cut due to being overpowered prior to the final release of the game, remaining an NPC. She was made playable again in the event [i]Under Tides[/i].

She is able to summon the familiar [[Mon3tr_(arknights)|]] during combat. Her motif is based on lynxes. Her callsign is the Russian word for "[i]calcite[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calcite.

She was designed by [[Lowlight Kirilenko]], who previously designed [[Kal'tsit (Pixiv Fantasia)|her]] and [[Mon5tr (Pixiv Fantasia)|her familiar]] for [[Pixiv Fantasia T]].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Hikasa Youko]] (JP), Liu Xue (CN), Sura Siu (EN), and Han Chae-eon (KR)

h4. Skins

She was debuted in the side story [i]Dorothy's Vision[/i], and later became playable in in the side story [i]Lone Trail[/i].

[spoilers]Due to her race, K'uk'ulkan. Her motif is based on Kukulkan, the Feathered Serpent deity of Mayan mythology.[/spoilers]

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Sawashiro Miyuki]] (JP), Hong Haitian (CN), Anne Yatco (EN), and Jang Mi (KR)

title: bosnia_and_herzegovina
body:
A small country in the Balkans, one of the earlier nations to break off from [[Yugoslavia]].

By the Dayton Agreement, the country is divided into three entities, two federal ones and a condominium between the two: the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina (dominated by the Bosniaks and Croats), [[Republika Srpska]] (dominated by the Serbs), and the Brčko District respectively. 

h4. See also

* [[Sarajevo]]
other_names: ボスニア・ヘルツェゴビナ

title: humanization
body:
Characters that were [b]already humanoid[/b] ([[android]]s, [[furry|furries]], [[monster girl]]s, humanoid [[mecha]], [[elf|elves]], etc) being depicted as more human-like than usual.

This typically involves the reduction, if not outright removal, of non-human features such as [[body fur]], [[horns]], [[wings]], [[colored skin]] or [[pointy ears]]. With furry characters, they are often turned into humans with [[animal ears]]. 

For characters that were not already humanoid, such as [[animal]]s, [[creature]]s, and [[non-humanoid robot]]s, please use [[personification]] instead.

h4. Examples
* !post #7568620
* !post #6258031
* !post #5323932
* !post #4677025

title: joko_widodo
body:
Joko Widodo is the ex-President of Indonesia, in office from 2014 to 2024. Previously he was Mayor of Surakarta from 2005 to 2012 and Governor of Jakarta from 2012 to 2014. He is the first Indonesian president not to have emerged from the country’s political elite or as an army general.

title: penis_envy
body:
A situation where one becomes envious on or feels inferior to another with a visibly larger [[penis]].

Unlike [[breast envy]], the penises do not have to be visible; just the implied reactions while looking down (such as talking about having an "inferior manhood") are enough.

h4. See also

* [[muscle envy]]
* [[penis awe]] 
* [[Tag Group:Body Parts]]

title: furrowed_brow
body:
When the skin on the forehead (the brow) becomes creased due to concentration or anxiety. Very commonly these skin wrinkles aren't explicitly drawn but are depicted as eyebrows with inner tips bending up.

[[Raised eyebrows]] may skip this tag if the entire eyebrow is a slight curve.

h4. Examples
* !post #5295546: raised
* !post #5306035: horizontal
* !post #5303894: v-shaped

h4. See also

* [[concentrating]]
* [[raised eyebrows]]
* [[v-shaped eyebrows]]
* [[Tag group:Face tags]]

title: frustrated
body:
When a character is dissatisfied, agitated, [[annoyed]], and/or discontent because of being unable to perform an action or fulfil a desire (often expressed by a [[facepalm]]).

h4. See Also
* [[flustered]]
* [[struggling]]

title: flustered
body:
A state of agitation that comes from being [[surprised|caught off guard]]. Often occurs as a result of sudden, unexpected romantic or sexual situations.

h4.See also
* [[confused]]
* [[embarrassed]]
* [[frustrated]]
* [[nervous]]
* [[shy]]
* [[panicking]]
* [[rejected kiss]]
* [[surprise hug]]
* [[surprise kiss]]

title: envy
body:
The desire to possess something that one lacked.

Not to be confused with [[jealous]], which involves someone who doesn't want to share something that they have, or believed to.

For the Full Metal Alchemist character see: [[Envy (fma)]].
h4. See also
* [[Breast envy]]
* [[Penis envy]]

title: jealous
body:
The desire to retain something that is perceived to belong to oneself - generally held to be possessions, but on this site largely pertains to the affections and intimacy of another person.

Not to be confused with [[envy]], which is the explicit or implicit desire to possess something that someone else has.

[[Touhou]] artists often use [[paru paru]] as the [[sound effects|onomatopoeia]] for jealousy, after [[Mizuhashi Parsee]].

h4. See also
* [[Envy (fma)]]
* [[breast envy]]
* [[penis envy]]

title: exhausted
body: When a character is very tired due to strenuous physical activity or [[exercising]]. See [[sleepy]] for when someone is tired due to lack of sleep.

title: excited
body:
A feeling of great enthusiasm, eagerness, or anticipation.

h4. See also

* [[+_+]]
* [[happy]]

title: disgust
body:
A feeling of strong disapproval or revulsion.

h4. See also

* [[angry]]
* [[annoyed]]
other_names: 養豚場の豚を見るような目

title: furious
body:
An emotion of deep, unbridled fury. A character who is furious is consumed with anger and is often past rational thinking.

Distinct from [[annoyed|annoyance]] and [[angry|anger]]; a furious character is far beyond the minor to moderate levels of the emotion defined by those tags.

h4. See also

* [[annoyed]]
* [[angry]]
* [[anger vein]]
* [[frown]]
* [[glaring]]
* [[grimace]]
* [[scowl]]
* [[v-shaped eyebrows]]
* [[Tag group:Face tags]]

title: angry
body:
A person who is angry. Especially evident when an [[anger vein]] is present, or when the character is [[glaring]].

Distinct from [[furious|fury]] and [[annoyed|annoyance]]; use this tag when a character is downright mad, but not quite furious and more than simply irritated.

h4. See also

* [[annoyed]]
* [[furious]]
* [[anger vein]]
* [[frown]]
* [[glaring]]

title: annoyed
body:
Mild anger, often caused by another's repeated troublesome actions. Annoyed characters will often appear tired or exasperated from having to endure another's antics.

Distinct from [[angry|anger]] and [[furious|fury]]; use this tag when the level of frustration a character is experiencing is relatively minor.

h4. See also

* [[angry]]
* [[excalibur face]]
* [[furious]]
* [[disgust]]
* [[glaring]]
* [[frown]]
* [[v-shaped eyebrows]]
* [[Tag group:Face tags]]

title: hana_(tokyo_godfathers)
body:
Hana is one of the three main protagonists of Satoshi Kon's [[Tokyo Godfathers]].
Hana is a trans woman, and a former drag queen. She was raised by her foster mother "Mother", another drag queen who took her in after she grew up in foster care as an abandoned child. Hana began to work in "Mother's" drag bar as a singer, but she left after attacking a rude customer who called her an "old fart". Sometime afterward, she met with Gin and Miyuki, and they began their living in [[Tokyo (city)|]] as homeless people.

title: miyuki_(tokyo_godfathers)
body: Miyuki is one of the three main protagonists of the [[Tokyo Godfathers]] movie. She's a runaway girl with a past she can’t talk about. And although she thinks of herself as an independent woman, Hana and Gin have been taking care of her so that she can survive life on the streets.

title: pencil
body:
A [[writing]] or [[drawing (action)|]] device consisting of a thin stick of pigment (usually graphite), usually encased in a thin wood cylinder.

This tag is for the presence of pencils in a picture. When tagging images drawn using pencils as the art medium, use [[graphite (medium)]] instead.

h4. See also

title: forever_young_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Named after a song by AK-69. It follows his dam's name as well.[/tn]
Japanese racehorse. Sired by Real Steel and foaled by Forever Darling.

He is famous for winning the 2023 Zen-Nippon Nisai Yushun and being undefeated until the 2024 Kentucky Derby, where he finished third in a photo-finish, behind winner Mystik Dan and runner-up Sierra Leone.

Forever Young's birthday falls on the same day as the release of the [[Umamusume]] game, February 24, 2021. A significant date for his owner, Fujita Susumu, CEO of CyberAgent, [[Cygames]]' parent company.

h4. Further reading:
* "Wikipedia:  Forever Young (horse)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forever_Young_(horse)]

title: shin_emperor_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]As in 'New' Emperor.[/tn]

French-bred Japanese racehorse. Sired by Siyouni and foaled by Starlet's Sister, he is a full brother to Sottsass, a winner of the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe.

He is notable for being owned by Fujita Susumu, President and CEO of CyberAgent, the parent company of Cygames, who are the creators and developers of [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. Shin Emperor is effectively Mr. Fujita's gamble for the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe.

body:
[[Final Fantasy]] vegetable monster. Known for its Bad Breath attack which inflicts a plethora of negative status effects.

The name Malboro comes from the Latin "mal boros", meaning "bad breath". It is also a parody name of the cigarette brand [[Marlboro]], to which smoking is also associated with bad breath.

Her New Year's outfit consists of a [[print kimono]] with an [[uroko (pattern)|]] pattern, a [[blue capelet|blue]] [[lace-trimmed capelet]], a [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[blue hakama|blue]] [[hakama skirt]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[lace-up boots]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]], it's the same as her [[oozora subaru (1st costume)|default costume]], but decorated with a [[white bow|white]] and [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]]s and 2 [[hair flower]]s.

title: vi_(league_of_legends)
body:
[b]Vi, the Piltover Enforcer[/b]

A human Champion from Piltover in [[League of Legends]] usually played in the Jungle or as Solo Top. She is known for her giant [[gauntlets]], which she uses to punch things with,  and reckless and rebellious personality. She participates in law enforcement alongside [[Caitlyn (league_of_legends)|]].

The main villain in Piltover and Zaun she tries to catch is [[Jinx (league_of_legends)|]]. 

She and Jinx are protagonists in the [[Arcane: League of Legends|Arcane]] Series. While she was younger, she was mostly called [[Violet_(arcane)|Violet]]

title: pee_pad
body: A pad or mat made of absorbent material used as a place for indoor pets to be able to urinate without soiling the floor.  The pads may be disposable or reusable, in which case they'd be washable.  Pee pads are also used together with [[litter box]]es where the litter box is placed in the middle of the pad and the pad is used to catch anything that might spill out when the box is being used.

title: romaji_text
body:
Romaji are Japanese words written in the Latin alphabet. It is seldom used in media, unless for the purpose of educating in the Japanese language or other special purposes. Sometimes used to explain, expound or guide in Kanji/Kana usage.

For Danbooru purposes, the tag refers to instances of Japanese text written in Latin alphabet where Japanese characters would normally be expected. Thus character names, trademarks etc. don't warrant the tag, even if technically they contain romanised Japanese text. Any piece of dialogue, however, as well as sound effects and similar elements which would normally be expected to be understood by Japanese speakers, but are for whatever reason rendered romanised, do qualify.

Do [b]not[/b] use this tag for Japanese words that have been fully incorporated into English, such as "[[sushi]]", "tsunami", or "[[sumo]]"; "senpai" and "sensei" are borderline.

h4. See also

* [[kunreishiki]]
* [[kiriji text]]
* [[pinyin text]]
* [[romaja text]]

title: suiseiseki
body:
[i]Jade Stone[/i]

The third [[Rozen Maiden]] doll, and [[Souseiseki]]'s older [[twins|twin]] [[sisters|sister]]. She battles with her [[watering can]], which she can use to enter dreams. She is mischievous and verbally abusive, but she does seem to care for the other dolls and does not enjoy the Alice Game. Known for saying [[desu]] a lot, which has then reached its memetic status. Inspired the net characters [[Jissouseki]] and [[Eigyouseki]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] in [[twin drills]] and [[red eyes|red]]-[[green eyes|green]] [[heterochromia]]. Her [[lolita fashion|outfit]] consists of a [[white headscarf]] with [[lace]], a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[long dress|long]] [[green dress]] with a [[frilled shirt collar|frilled]] [[collared dress|collar]] tied with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]] and [[long sleeves]], a [[black corset]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black ]] [[shoes]].

title: miku_collar_bikini
body:
A drawing trend based on either [[maud0239]] or [[channel (caststation)|]]'s drawing of [[Hatsune Miku]] in a striped bikini but with her collar, [[necktie]], and [[detached sleeves]] still worn as well.

Channel's drawing has Miku wearing a very [[crop top|cropped]] version of her white shirt with a [[micro bikini]]. Maud's version has her wear only the [[detached_collar|collar]] of her grey shirt, as well as [[Kagamine Rin]] likewise wearing only the [[sailor collar]], [[neckerchief]], and [[arm warmers]] of her own outfit.

Channel's art was posted in November 2023, months earlier before the trend began. But after Maud posted their art in June 2024, Channel "replied":[https://twitter.com/_CASTSTATION/status/1797961117282828612] to it with a repost of their own version, saying they wanted this kind of Miku to start trending, and thus it did.

* !post #6908324: [[channel (caststation)|]]'s version
* !post #7670286: [[maud0239]]'s version

title: kylar_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

An aggressive and obnoxious school athlete who enjoys takes great pride in playing on the school's [[lacrosse]] team. Kylar is depicted as a stereotypical jock who is rather unintelligent and prone to violence. In some routes, he displays cases of extremism.

title: jeffrey_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

He is depicted as a socially awkward [[otaku]] and geek, who passionately shares his perverted interests to the female students, much to their discomfort. His interests and personality makes him a constant target for [[bullying]], especially from [[Nicole (class of 09)|Nicole]] and [[Kylar (class of 09)|Kylar]].

body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

An aspiring actress and honor roll student, Megan's passion and strive for high marks has encouraged her to view herself as superior to her peers. She's known for her arrogance and bossiness, this is depicted in one route where [[Nicole (class of 09)|Nicole]] uses Megan's pride of being in a relationship against her in one route.

title: blood_elf_(warcraft)
body:
A race of [[elf|elves]] from the [[Warcraft]] series.  Their notably feature is their [[glowing eyes]] that are usually [[green_eyes|green]] due to their exposure to fel energy and their very long eyebrows.  Similar to other elves from Warcraft their [[pointy ears]] are [[long_pointy_ears|very long]].

They frequently are depicted wearing clothing and armor with the color scheme of red with gold.

They're a derivative of the original Warcraft High Elves, but have turned to Fel energy upon the destruction of the High Elves' Sunwell from which they originally drew their energy upon.

She cosplays as [[Lustalotte (2.5 Jigen no Ririsa)|]].

title: samwise_gamgee
body: Samwise Gamgee (/ˈsæmˌwaɪz ˈɡæmˌdʒiː/, usually called Sam) is a fictional character in J. R. R. Tolkien's Middle-earth. A hobbit, Samwise is the chief supporting character of [[The Lord of the Rings]], serving as the loyal companion (in effect, the manservant) of the protagonist [[Frodo Baggins]]. Sam is a member of the Company of the Ring, the group of nine charged with destroying the One Ring to prevent the Dark Lord Sauron from taking over the world.
other_names: サムワイズ・ギャムジー

title: nerf_maverick_rev-6
body:
The Maverick is a revolver-style blaster with an auto-advancing six-dart cylinder. The Maverick can be reloaded by pressing the button on the left of the blaster to swing the cylinder out, allowing for quick reloading. It has one tactical rail atop the priming slide, followed by a small sight and also a lanyard attachment point. The Maverick's cylinder advances counter-clockwise (when viewed from the front) on trigger pull.

The original blue version of the Maverick is noticeably more powerful than the newer yellow ones, primarily because of a better O-ring.

While the Maverick can accept most Micro Dart and Elite Dart variants, Tagger Micro Darts and Whistler Darts are known to cause jams unless they are fully pushed into the cylinder's barrels.

It was released in 2004

title: dreamy_glimmer_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. It could only be acquired through a limited time gacha banner. The appearance of the outfit and its hairstyle are inspired by [[Marilyn Monroe]].

The outfit includes a [[long_dress|long]] [[glitter_dress|glittery]] [[layered_dress|layered]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[mermaid dress]], [[short_gloves|short]] [[frilled_gloves|frilled]] [[black gloves]], [[white stockings]], [[pink footwear|pink]] [[high heels]], a [[black_ribbon|black]] [[ribbon choker]], [[heart earrings]], and a white [[feather boa|fur boa]]. The hairstyle  for the outfit is [[medium hair|medium length]] [[blonde hair]].

It has an alternate color evolution with a red dress and black hair.

title: staff_of_selection_(fate)
body:
The [[staff]] wielded by [[Artoria Caster (fate)|]], symbolizing her as the Fairy of Prophecy for the land of [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|Faerie Britain]]. It bears a great resemblance to [[Merlin (fate)|]]'s staff, and serves as a parallel to the [[Caliburn (fate)|Sword of Selection]].

In her [[Artoria Caster (third ascension) (fate)|third ascension]], she trades out the staff for [[Marmyadose (fate)|]] as her primary weapon in battle.

[spoiler][[Aesc (fate)|]] originally had a similar Spear of Selection, but it became corrupted after she lost faith in the fairies of Britain and she sealed it away. The various staffs she's seen with are instead ordinary staffs. This spear would later be gifted to [[Percival (fate)|]], whereupon it transformed into a [[Longinus (weapon) (fate)|Longinus]] look-alike.[/spoiler]

This tag is currently used for an artist/[[eromanga]]ka.

title: film_strip
body:
A strip of still images that can be played back on a [[projector]] to depict a moving image. Perforations in the sides of the strip allow it to be moved by a projector's mechanism. Film strips can also depict photos taken by a non-video [[camera]].

title: floral_memory_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it enables [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] to fly over vast distances, but only in specific areas of the world map. It can be acquired by players for free by playing through the main story.

The outfit includes a [[blue_skirt|blue]] [[layered_skirt|layered]] [[high-waist skirt]] decorated with [[floral print]] and a [[back bow]], a [[white_shirt|white]] [[sleeveless_shirt|sleeveless]] [[frilled shirt]], [[pantyhose]] that are colored in a [[gradient_legwear|gradient]] from dark blue to gray, [[short_gloves|short]] [[black_gloves|black]] [[frilled gloves]] with [[pearl bracelets]], and [[black_footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. The hairstyle for the outfit is a [[very long hair|very long]] [[gray_hair|gray]] [[high ponytail]] with a black [[hair bow]].

It has an alternate color evolution with a primarily orange and black color scheme, dark brunette hair, and diamond pattern with fruit print on the skirt.

title: the_witcher_(series)
body:
The Witcher (Polish: Wiedźmin) is a series of [[fantasy]] novels written by Polish author Andrzej Sapkowski, adapted into a game series developed by [[CD Projekt RED]], as well as a live action series on [[Netflix]]. The series revolves around the eponymous "witcher," [[Geralt of Rivia]]. In Sapkowski's works, "witchers" are beast hunters who develop supernatural abilities at a young age to battle wild beasts and monsters.

h4. Installments

Her default costume consists of a [[black choker|black]] [[lace-trimmed choker]], a [[black coat|black]] [[fur-trimmed coat]], a [[black dress|black]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[short dress|short]] [[layered dress]] with a [[chest belt]]/[[breast strap]], a [[black belt]] with a [[belt pouch]] with a small book inside, [[uneven legwear|uneven]] [[mismatched legwear]] (a [[black thighhighs|black]] [[striped thighhighs|striped]] [[single thighhigh|thighigh]] on her right leg and a [[black socks|black]] [[fishnet socks|fishnet]] [[single kneehigh|kneehigh]] on her left leg), and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[platform heels|platform]] [[lace-up boots]]. She also has black [[arm strap]]s, [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]]/[[arm warmers]] and multiple [[ring]]s as accessories.

title: twilight
body:
Twilight occurs shortly after [[sunset]] and immediately before [[sunrise]], when the [[sun]]'s light illuminates part of the sky. If any part of the sun is still visible, use one of the aforementioned tags instead. 

Unrelated to [[twilight (series)|the teen vampire book and its succeeding series]].

* !asset #24340888: Twilight occurs twice a day, before sunrise and after sunset
h4.See also

* [[dusk]]: time after sunset with visible sunlight
* [[dawn]]: time before sunrise with visible sunlight
* [[sunrise]] the sun crossing the horizon in the morning
* [[sunset]]: the sun setting beneath the horizon

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twilight]

title: dusk
body:
The time immediately after [[sunset]] where no [[sun]] is visible, but is close enough to the [[horizon]] to light up the sky. Typical hues of this time of day are orange, red, and purple.

If any part of the sun is visible, tag [[sunset]] instead.

* !asset #24340888: Dusk marks the end of twilight after sunset

h4. See also

* [[sunrise]]: the sun crossing the horizon in the morning
* [[sunset]]: the sun setting beneath the horizon
* [[dawn]]: time before sunrise with visible sunlight
* [[twilight]]: period between dawn-sunrise and sunset-dawn

title: sunset
body:
The [[sun]] setting beneath the [[horizon]] in the [[evening]]. If the sun is no longer visible, tag it [[dusk]] instead.

Distinguishing between [[sunrise]] and [[sunset]] can be difficult, so only tag [[sunset]] if the sky hues appear more orange or red, as is most prevalent in media.

* !asset #24340888: Sunset occurs before dusk

h4. See also

* [[sunrise]] the sun crossing the horizon in the morning
* [[dawn]]: time before sunrise with visible sunlight
* [[dusk]]: time after sunset with visible sunlight
* [[twilight]]: period between dawn-sunrise and sunset-dawn

title: dawn
body:
The time immediately before [[sunrise]] where no [[sun]] is visible, but is close enough to the [[horizon]] to light up the sky. Typical hues of this time of day are white, blue, and yellow.

If any part of the sun is visible, tag [[sunrise]] instead.

* !asset #24340888: Dawn marks the beggining of twilight before sunrise

h4. See also

* [[sunrise]]: the sun crossing the horizon in the morning
* [[sunset]]: the sun setting beneath the horizon
* [[dusk]]: time after sunset with visible sunlight
* [[twilight]]: period between dawn-sunrise and sunset-dawn

title: judau_ashta
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He is the main protagonist of the [[Gundam ZZ]] TV anime series from 1986.

[b]Judau Ashta[/b] is the young [[pilot]] of the [[ZZ Gundam]] [[mobile_suit|MS]].

Born in the Shangri-La colony at the Side 1 [[O'Neill Cylinder]], Judau was originally part of a band of teenage [spoilers]newtype[/spoilers] scavengers who sold damaged mobile suit parts and other mechanical junk for money. He has a little sister called [[Leina Ashta]].

A casual encounter with the crew of the MS pilot depleted [[Argama]] and the [[AEUG]] survivors of the last battle of [[zeta_gundam|The Gryps War]] forces Judau to become part of the [i][[Gundam Team]][/i] and use the [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam]] and then the ZZ Gundam against the menace of [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]].

title: mouar_pharaoh
body:
[quote][i]"I said I'd be by your side, Jerid..."[/i] - Mouar Pharaoh[/quote]

A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. She appears in the [[Zeta Gundam]] anime TV series from 1985. 

One of [[Jerid Messa]]'s love interests and a [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] pilot. Her mecha of choice are the [[Hizack]] and the [[Gabthley]]. 

[spoilers]Goes the way of the dodo via [[Kamille Bidan]], like many others. She takes a beam shot from [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Kamille's Zeta Gundam]] intended for Jerid, successfully saving him but also dying in the process.[/spoilers]

title: anya's_heh_face_(meme)
body:

A variant on the meme is based on an image of cosplayer "Miyamoto":[https://twitter.com/saki_miyamoto/status/1381947099344822272] "Saki":[https://twitter.com/saki_miyamoto/status/1381943187820802053] wearing a shirt with the smug face, while simultaneously perfectly replicating that very same smug face herself.

title: bye-bye_dust_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it enables [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] to groom animals in order to collect resources from them. It can be acquired by advancing through the main story.

The outfit includes a [[blue shirt]] with [[frilled_sleeves|frilled]] [[see-through_sleeves|transparent]] [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[yellow apron]] with a [[paw print]] decoration, [[blue shorts]] with a [[bubble print|bubble]] and [[water drop print|water drop]] pattern, a [[blue hat|blue]] [[frilled hat|frilled]] [[mob cap]] decorated with a [[bow]] and [[pom pom hat ornament]], [[short gloves|short]] [[frilled gloves|frilled]] [[blue gloves]], and [[yellow shoes]] with [[frilled socks|frilled]] [[pink socks]].

It has an alternate color evolution that is primarily black and white, with a pattern that resembles a cats fur.

body:
[[Melusine (fate)|]] in her Final Ascension outfit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. This is a rare instance of a character gaining a unique costume for their Final Ascension. She has two long vertical horns, and wears a [[revealing clothes|revealing outfit]] consisting of a white cloth over her breasts, white panties, some black dragon scales, and white dragon wings.

title: omochao
body:
A recurring character in the [[sonic_(series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series, first appearing in [[sonic_adventure_2|Sonic Adventure 2]]. A robotic [[chao_(sonic)|Chao]] with a propeller on his head and a [[winding_key|wind-up key]] on his back. Omochao usually appears as an in-game guide, giving hints to the playable characters during gameplay. He is often seen as an annoyance by most players, regardless. His name comes from 'omocha', the word for 'toy'.

h4. See also
* "Sonic Retro: Omochao":https://info.sonicretro.org/Omochao

title: rick_(dqb2)
body:
[B]Rick[/b] is a [[soldier]] in [[Dragon Quest Builders 2]] that players can encounter. He is referred to as [b]Warwick[/b] in the English localization.

[Spoilers] He is later revealed to be an antagonist that purposely sewed discord amongst his peers so he could become a monster as a means to avoid death. He is granted the form of a Silvapithecus and is shortly after slain by the player. [/spoilers]

title: winds_of_purity_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it is used by [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] to shoot energy blasts to fight enemies and collect essences. It can be acquired for free by playing through the main story.

The outfit includes a [[white_dress|white]] [[halter dress]] which fades to green around the skirt and has ribbons trailing from the back, [[detached_sleeves|detached]] [[puffy long sleeves]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[high heel sandals|high heel]] [[cross-laced sandals]]. The hairstyle for this outfit is [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[low-braided long hair]]. Accessories for the outfit include a golden headband of branches and flowers, resmebling a [[laurel crown]], and a pair of golden [[crescent earrings|crescent moon earrings]].

It has an alternate color evolution with a white dress that fades to blue, and black hair.

Her arms and legs also become more draconic in appearance.

title: kronshtadt_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the lead ship (and name ship) of a Soviet large/battle cruiser (project 69) that was only partially built. 
Character designed by [[Dishwasher1910]], voiced by [[Hondo Kaede]].

Her default outfit consists of a two-tone [[double-breasted]] dress, [[pantyhose]], [[thigh strap]]s [[black gloves]], and a large [[fur-trimmed cape|fur-trimmed]] [[white cape]]. She also has a [[sword]] slung to her back waist.

She uses massive [[rigging]] that is in line with the Northern Parliament/Russian faction's ice-crusted animalistic style with her real-life triple-mount main guns arranged in line to face forward.

title: masquerade_mask
body:
Masquerade masks are face masks, commonly worn by the upper class at "Masquerade balls":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masquerade_ball with the purpose of hiding one's identity and expressing oneself.

They have been used in classics such as The Phantom of the Opera, Romeo and Juliet, Lone Ranger, and Gossip Girl. They are still used in many types of media today.

h4. See also

* [[domino mask]]
* [[Phantom of the Opera]]

title: shimousa_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b][s]Pseudo-Singularity III[/s] Pseudo-Parallel World: The Stage of Carnage, Shimousa[/b]
[quote]
Miyamoto Musashi...a strange woman encountered in the minute Singularity.
The concept of Pruning Theoretical Phenomenon...and a being who continuously warps from one world to another...

Too much remains a mystery about this woman.
Historically, Miyamoto Musashi was a man who made his mark on the world as a master swordsman.
What reason could there be for these two who share a name to be split as they are?

A new story unfolds after Musashi reappears and reunites with everyone at Chaldea.
The time has come for the Seven Duels of Swordmasters to begin.
[/quote]
The third "pseudo-singularity" in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in the historical region of Shimousa in [[Japan]] in the year 1639 (or Kan'ei 16). It's later determined that rather than being a pseudo-singularity, it's actually a parallel world [spoiler]similar to a Lostbelt set up by [[Ashiya Douman (fate)|]] and the Alien God.[/spoiler] Unlike other singularities, Ritsuka arrives in Shimousa through dreaming instead of by rayshifting.

Released on the Japanese server on October 14, 2017 and on the NA server on October 10, 2019. It was adapted into a manga by [[Wataru Rei]].

Upon release of Shimousa (and the other pseudo-singularities), the true name of several new servants was initially hidden; however official Fate/Grand Order media would later forego keeping their true names hidden in promotional materials. Their aliases are listed below, but their true names are used on Danbooru for tagging.

h4. Characters

title: wentos
body: A mysterious traveling merchant who shows up in various hubs across the world in [i][[Sonic Unleashed]][/i]. He is a shy and secretive figure who roams the world selling items and collectibles to the player, known for his shyness and reluctance to interact directly with customers. To compensate for this, he uses a [[Chao (Sonic)|Chao]] hand puppet to communicate, with the puppet often taking on a more confident and assertive persona during transactions.

title: kumano_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Kumano[/i]. Character design by [[Pyon-kichi]], voiced by [[Waki Azumi]]. 

She is portrayed as a [[gyaru]] with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[purple eyes]], red [[horns]], [[sharp teeth]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit, being a gyaru in theme, appropriately consists of a [[school uniform]] setup with a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], purple [[bowtie]], red [[choker]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[brown cardigan]] [[cardigan around waist|tied to her waist]], [[black socks]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces each with a single 20.3 cm twin mount and held by her funnel and bridge structure to her back, with triple 610 mm [[torpedo tubes]] [[thigh strap|strapped to her thighs]]. She also has a mast on her back rig containing her [[radar]] set.

Unlike her three other sisters, she has a noticeably [[Royal Navy]] theme to her outfit, as she was the only member of her class to have been built in the UK. In particular, she wears a Royal Navy uniform with an [[ascot]] while her [[horns]] are false horns attached to her hat.

Character design by [[Criin]].

title: kiev_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the name ship of her class of destroyers in [[Azur Lane]].

[i]Kiev[/i] was historically designed as a follow-on to the [i]Tashkent[/i]-class design (Project 48/48K) when it became clear that Italian shipbuilding practices were incompatible with the comparatively inferior Soviet shipbuilding industry and practices. [i]Kiev[/i] and her sisters were to be cheaper versions of [i]Tashkent[/i] with virtually the same armament. All were canceled or scrapped by the time of the German invasion of the Soviet Union. Only Kiev by far has been launched and revised as the 48K for post-war reparations but then was scrapped due to material shortages.

Destroyers of her class also have a planned speed about 42.5 knots and one of the destroyers to have an Auxillary gun.

h4. Skins 
* !post #5159959: Default
* !post #6008180:  [[kiev (backstreet silver sonata) (azur lane)|Backstreet Silver Sonata]]

h4. See also

title: aang
body:
The main character of [[Avatar: The Last Airbender]].

In the series, he is the current incarnation of the Avatar, a powerful being capable of controlling all four elements. He is an [[aerokinesis|Airbender]] who is the reincarnation of the previous avatar, [[Roku (Avatar)|]].

[spoiler]After Avatar: The Last Airbender he marries [[Katara]] and their children are [[Kya (legend of korra)|]], [[Tenzin (legend of korra)|]], and [[Bumi (legend of korra)|]]. In [[The Legend of Korra]] his grandchildren are [[Jinora]], [[Ikki (legend of korra)|]], and [[Meelo (legend of korra)|]].[/spoiler]

h4. Profile
[b]Aang[/b] is [[bald]] with a blue [[arrow_(symbol)|arrow]] [[tattoo]] on his [[forehead]] but when his hair is grown it's [[short hair|short]], [[curly hair|curly]], and [[black hair|black]]. He is usually wearing a red and yellow air nomad attire with a [[staff]].

His animal companions are [[Appa]] and [[Momo (avatar)|]].
other_names: アン(アバター伝説の少年アン)

title: suzunami_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Suzunami[/i]. 

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[cat ears]] and [[cat tail|tail]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[white dress]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[black sleeves]] and [[detached collar|collar]], [[feather boa]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[platform footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces: her right side contains two 12.7 cm twin gun mounts and the bridge structure, while her left side contains a [[smokestack|funnel]] and quad 61 cm [[torpedo tubes]].

title: juneau_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the [i]Atlanta[/i]-class light cruiser [i]Juneau[/i] seen in [[azur_lane|Azur Lane]]. She has short, platinum [[blonde hair]] and [[red eyes]] in a bob cut, as well as a very petite figure. Her rigging consists of several 5”/38 twin mounts on either side, and she appears to be holding a handgun of indeterminate make.

Juneau has an extremely timid personality, traumatized over the events of her sinking. She starts out very afraid of the Commander, and is terrified of physical contact of any kind. She will also make numerous references to the Sullivan Brothers, all five of whom perished when she exploded and sank. 

Note: her [[pixiv]] tag is translated as "Juneau (Union)" to avoid confusion with [[Juno (Azur Lane)|]] as they share the same katakana.

h4. Skins

title: jintsuu_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Jintsuu[/i]. Character design by [[Jianren]], voiced by [[Kanemoto Hisako]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]], and animalistic [[animal ears|ears]] and [[tail]]. She wears a mix of traditional [[Japanese clothes]] with a white [[pleated skirt]]. She is also shown to be holding a [[folding fan]] (two at retrofit). Her [[rigging]] at base form contains two 14 cm single mounts, one on each side.

For her retrofit form, see her [[jintsuu (retrofit) (azur lane)|corresponding page.]]

title: amaterasu_(ookami)
body:
[quote]
For other usages, see [[Amaterasu]] (disambiguation wiki).
[/quote]
[b]Amaterasu[/b] ([b]天照[/b]), nicknamed [b]Ammy[/b] by [[Issun]], is the main protagonist of [[Ookami (game)|]]. In her past life she was known as [[Shiranui (ookami)|]]. Amaterasu is the Ōkami, the Sun Goddess to all of Nippon, and the "[i]origin of all that is good and mother to us all[/i]".

She wields 3 divine instruments: a [[reflector_(ookami)|reflector]] ([[shield]]), a [[rosary_(ookami)|]] (string of [[magatama]] beads), and a [[glaive_(ookami)|]] ([[sword]]).

A popular practice for fans of [i]Okami[/i] is to draw what one would assume a "human Amaterasu would look like":/posts?tags=personification+amaterasu_(ookami). Many variations exist.

She has a son, [[Chibiterasu]], who is the protagonist of [[Ookamiden]].

title: greyhound
body: A British breed of a [[dog]] with slender body and long legs. Greyhounds are best known for their incredibly fast running speed.

title: let_me_do_it_for_you_(meme)
body:
A parody cover of FKA Twigs' song "Cellophane", sung in the (impersonated) voice of Miss Piggy from the [[Muppets]]. Associated with a close-up image of  [[dog]]s with long faces, most specifically [[borzoi]]s.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Let Me Do It For You":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/miss-piggy-cellophane-cover-let-me-do-it-for-you]

title: squidward_looking_out_the_window_(meme)
body:
A macro [[meme]] originated from [[Spongebob Squarepants (series)|]].

The scene involves [[squidward tentacles|Squidward]] [[looking outside|looking out]] his [[window]] at [[spongebob squarepants|Spongebob]] and his friend [[patrick star|Patrick]] having fun. The image has been used in situations where one is jealously observing others having fun but can't participate themselves.

h4. See also
* "Know Your Meme entry":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/squidward-looking-out-the-window

title: patrick_star
body:
One of the main characters of [[Spongebob Squarepants (series)|]]. He is an anthromorphic pink sea star with childish and somewhat foolish personality. He usually tags along with his friend [[spongebob squarepants|Spongebob]].

h4. External links

* "Patrick Star | Encyclopedia SpongeBobia | Fandom":[https://spongebob.fandom.com/wiki/Patrick_Star]

title: gangster_spongebob_(meme)
body:
[[Meme]] originated from an image of [[Spongebob Squarepants]] in a green [[gangster]] outfit [[holding money]] while giving a [[thumbs up]] to the viewer.

Despite the meme's popularity, the source of the image remains unknown.

title: criminal_(meitantei_conan)
body:
A stock character from [[Meitantei Conan]], depicted as a black-[[silhouette]]d masculine humanoid figure completely lacking in any distinctive features aside from occasional [[evil smile]].

He is used to represents the mystery culprit while they are committing crimes, destroy the evidence, or even attempted to harm the protagonist and others. The intended usage of this character is to hide the identity of culprit until the mystery is solved.

Due to his ubiquitous appearance throughout the series, along with the occasional discrepancy between him and the culprit's actual look, he has gained [[meme]]tic status in Japan, where he was often called as the "true culprit" behind each crimes and often used as a "generic" villain by various artists for humorous purposes. This has reached the point that he was given his own "spin-off":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Case_Closed:_The_Culprit_Hanzawa which received an anime adaptation in 2022.

title: fairy_tail_logo
body:
A crest of the Fairy Tail guild, the titular magician's guild from the [[Fairy Tail]] series. It appears as a stylized wing of various color.

Like many other guild symbol of the series, it is [[tattoo]]ed onto somewhere of the member's body, typically on the back of their hand or their shoulder.

body: English: It Might Be Painful, but I Still Love It. A song by [[TUYU (band)|]], second ending theme of [[Tokyo Revengers|Tokyo Revengers: Seiya Kessen-hen]].

title: goho_mafia!_kajita-kun
body:
A [[4koma]] comedy series illustrated by [[bkub]] and co-written by [[Mafia Kajita]], who also stars as the manga's host. Frequent guests in the manga include seiyuu [[Sugita Tomokazu]] and [[Nakamura Yuuichi]], and mangaka [[Umino Chika (character)|]], as well as [[duckman|bkub]] himself and [[Fakkuma (character)|]].

Published by Kadokawa, the manga was originally serialized in their monthly 電撃G's magazine from May of 2017 to September of 2020, before transitioning to being serialized directly on Mafia Kajita's Twitter account. Bkub would go on to contribute to future Kajita projects as well, such as [[WashaganaTV]].

title: gullveig_(fire_emblem)
body:
Character from [[Fire Emblem Heroes]]. The apparent antagonist of Book VII, the Golden Seer who mastered time.

[spoilers]She is actually a version of [[Seidr (Fire Emblem)|]] from the future, who succumbed to the Golden Curse by the machinations of [[Njordr (Fire Emblem)|]], and is doomed to repeat the destructive cycle for eternity.[/spoilers]

Popular from the moment of her reveal, she surprisingly won the Choose Your Legends event the same year she debuted, within weeks of being introduced.

title: tomoe_gozen_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Referenced in the Babylonia singularity as one of the heroes Gilgamesh summoned to defend his kingdom, and who later perished defeating an enemy commander. She makes her playable debut in the third Epic of Remnant chapter. Despite her steadfast nature and her fiery and graceful style of combat (she wields a [[sword]], a [[naginata]], and a [[bow_(weapon)|bow]] with great proficiency), she has a more playful side (shown in My Room where she expresses great interest in playing video games).

Has [[black horns]], due to having some oni ancestry. These only become visible starting with her second ascension. The horns are initially [[black horns|black]] but turn [[red horns|red horns]] for her third ascension. She also has [[very long hair|very long]] [[aqua hair|aqua]], [[light blue hair|light blue]], or [[grey hair]] (sometimes in a [[ponytail]], or with a white [[headband]] and a [[red bow]]) and [[red eyes]]. Usually wears a [[short kimono|short]] [[white kimono]] with an [[obi]] and [[detached sleeves]], and [[hakama pants]] with [[side slit|side slits]]. Sometimes she also has [[kote]] and [[kusazuri]]. Her later outfit looks like a [[sleeveless turtleneck]] showing some [[sideboob]]. Her kote and kusazuri looks more colorful.

For the Summer 2020 event, [[Tomoe Gozen (Swimsuit Saber) (Fate)|an alternate Saber-class Servant version of Tomoe Gozen]] was introduced.

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[Shirabi]]
[b]Voice Actress[/b]: [[Kanemoto Hisako]]

title: anilive_jumpstart_program
body:
A program by [[AniLive]] in which aspiring streamers can apply to stream in AniLive and receive a model by doing so. While classified as [[indie virtual youtuber|indies]], they take on the title of the program as if they're a corporate [[virtual YouTuber]]. In it's initial volume, each streamer got a Live2D model, while in its second volume streamers would get PNG models, which were allegedly [[ai-generated|generated by AI]]. Following allegations of AI being used to create its PNG models, AniLive later opted to commission human artists for their PNG models, some of which illustrated models for [[NEXAS (vtuber)|]].

Most of the VTubers in this program have their model artists uncredited, with a few exceptions.

As of December 2024, there are currently 42 members in the program, with at least 10 members who have either undebuted, graduated or left.

title: camilla_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Camilla[/b] (カミラ Kamira) is a playable character in [i][[Fire Emblem Fates]][/i].

The eldest princess of the Nohrian royal family, Camilla carries herself with maturity and elegance on the onset but treats her family with unrivalled care and affection. She is ruthless on the battlefield, destroying her enemies with wild abandon. Along with the other royal siblings, she was subject to the family's "concubine wars" at a young age. She bathes the longest out of anyone in the army, and her birthday is on November 30th.

Camilla has [[very long hair|very]] [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[purple hair]] with [[hair over one eye|one bang covering her left eye]], [[purple eyes]], full [[lips]], [[large breasts]], and well-shaped [[thighs]]. She dons [[black armor|black]] [[armor]] shaped like a [[bodice]] that exposes her [[cleavage]] and [[groin]], also showing off her [[black panties|black]] [[panties]] and leaving her [[ass]] visible (post #2147528 for an official example). She also wears [[armored boots|armored]] [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots|thigh-length]] [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[boots]] and a [[tiara]]. Camilla is often portrayed riding her [[undead]] [[wyvern]] and wielding a [[battle axe]].

She is voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]] in Japanese. "Paula Tiso":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Tiso voices her in English [i][[Fire Emblem Fates|Fates]][/i], and "Misty Lee":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Misty_Lee voices her in English [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] and [[Fire Emblem Warriors]].

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Revenant Knight (Malig Knight)

title: diner_dash
body:
[b]Diner Dash[/b] is a strategy and time management videogames series formerly developed by Gamelab and published by PlayFirst and now currently owned by Glu Mobile.

The game follows [[Flo (diner dash)|]], a former stock broker who quits her job due to stress and opens her own diner in the fictional town of Dinertown. Soon Flo begins helping her friends who experience problems with their own restaurants as well.

title: oozora_subaru_(hololive_summer_2019)
body:
The original [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Oozora Subaru]], first featured in the [i]hololive Idol Project 2019 Summer[/i].

It consists of an [[orange bikini|orange]] or [[yellow bikini|yellow]] [[striped bikini]] with a [[halterneck]], a [[two-sided jacket|two-sided]],[[two-tone jacket|two-toned]] [[green jacket|]] and [[yellow jacket]] with a [[duck hood|duck]] [[hooded jacket|hood]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this swimsuit is [[short hair]] with [[swept bangs]] with a [[polka dot hairband|polka dot]] [[hair bow|bow]] [[bow hairband|hairband]].

title: oozora_subaru_(work)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Oozora Subaru]].

Her second costume consists of a [[grey headwear|grey]] [[sailor hat]] a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[cropped jacket]] with [[sleeve cuffs]], an [[armband]] and golden [[buttons]], a [[high collar|high-collared]] [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[grey shirt|grey]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with a [[vertical-striped shirt|vertical]] [[pinstripe shirt|pinstripe]] pattern, a [[black bowtie]] with a golden [[star (symbol)|]], [[blue shorts]] with [[suspenders]] and a [[large bow|large]] [[back bow]] and [[hip vent]]s [[panty peek|showing the waistband]] of her [[lace-trimmed panties|lace-trimmed]] [[black panties]], [[grey thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]]. As this is the costume that Subaru uses for her "Oozora Police department" stream, it is also often drawn with a [[police hat]] instead of her sailor hat.

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[short hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and a [[french braid|french]] [[side braid]] held with a golden [[star hair ornament|star]] [[hairclip]].

title: anata_wo_hannin_desu
body:
Meme stemming from a typo in [[Tsukihime]], wherein [[Hisui (tsukihime)|]]'s line "anata wa hannin desu" ("you are the criminal/culprit") was misprinted in the game as "anata wo hannin desu" ("you, be the criminal/culprit!"). 

This incident was seized upon by fans and Type-Moon alike, and gave rise to the meme, as well as the [[brainwasher_detective|Brainwasher Detective]] character.

title: transformers:_rise_of_the_beasts
body:
The 7th [[transformers (live action)|live action]] [[Transformers]] film and the 2nd movie in the reboot Transformers live action movies that was released in 2023. It is also the first Transformers live action movie to feature the [[Maximal|]]s from [[Beast Wars]].

Set in 1994, the Autobots join forces with the Maximals as they try to stop a group of evil Transformers called Terrorcons from summoning their master, [[Unicron]], who plans to devour Earth.

The film received mixed reviews since it lack the same charm as it's predecessor, [[Bumblebee (film)|]], and continue the same mindless action of the previous Bay movies. The film is notable in it's end credits with an upcoming sequel and crossover with [[G.I. Joe]].

title: sarong
body:
A large sheet of fabric worn around the waist as a [[skirt]], usually over a [[bikini]]. It's usually tied into a knot at one side of the hip.

The Japanese word for sarong is パレオ ([i]pareo[/i]). Technically, a pareo and a sarong are different garments: the former originates in Tahiti, the latter in Malaysia. In their traditional, native forms they might be distinguished. However they are usually equivalent in common usage.

h4. Examples

* !post #8129810
* !post #7825232

h4. See also

* [[swimsuit cover-up]]

title: japan_maritime_self-defense_force
body:
The [b]Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force[/b] (海上自衛隊, [i]Kaijou Jieitai[/i], abbreviated as [i]Kaiji[/i] or [i]JMSDF[/i]) is the naval branch of the [[Japan Self-Defense Force]]. It is the modern successor to the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], a position it shares with the [[Japan Coast Guard]].

As it is officially a self-defense force, not a military navy, almost all of the JMSDF's large surface ships are called 護衛艦 ([i]goei-kan[/i], lit. "guard ship" or "escort ship") and officially classed as destroyers. However, the term does not include submarines, mine warfare vessels, variants of patrol boat, landing & transport vessels and training ships. The fact that [[JS Izumo (DDH-183)|Izumo]]-class helicopter carriers with a displacement of nearly 20,000 tons are called "destroyers" is often the butt of jokes.

Unlike the [[Japan Ground Self-Defense Force]], which dropped most traditions associated with the [[Imperial Japanese Army]], the JMSDF still maintains many traditions of its predecessor, the Imperial Japanese Navy. For example, their tradition of eating [[curry rice]] for lunch every weekend was handed down from the IJN.

h4. See also

* [[Imperial Japanese Navy]]
* [[Japan Ground Self-Defense Force]]
* [[Japan Air Self-Defense Force]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Maritime_Self-Defense_Force

title: japan_self-defense_force
body:
The [b]Japan Self-Defense Forces[/b] (Japanese: 自衛隊, romanized: Jieitai; abbreviated JSDF), also known as the Japanese Armed Forces, are the unified [[military]] forces of [[Japan]] established in 1954.

The self-defence forces consists of the [[Japan Ground Self-Defense Force]], the [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]], and the [[Japan Air Self-Defense Force]]. They are controlled by the Ministry of Defense, with the Prime Minister as commander-in-chief.

h4. See also
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Self-Defense_Forces]

title: afternoon_shine_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it enables [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] to catch bugs. It can be acquired by progressing the main story.

The outfit includes a gray or green [[sweater]] with [[long sleeves]] that end in [[frills]]. Worn over the sweater is a set of [[yellow overalls]] with frilled straps, [[pocket|pockets]], a [[flower brooch]], and a design of a [[bee_print|bee]] printed on the chest. For legwear it includes [[white_socks|white]] [[kneehighs|kneehigh socks]] trimmed with [[ribbon_legwear|ribbon]], and [[brown shoes]] with yellow laces. The outfit's hairstyle is [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied into [[twintails]] with [[parted bangs]] and a [[hair_flower|flower hair ornament]]. Accessories for the outfit include a [[yellow_hat|yellow]] [[sun_hat]] with a [[blue ribbon]] tied around it, which is worn on the back, and a [[butterfly net]] with the net actually shaped like a butterfly.

Has an alternate color evolution with black overalls, a white and orange striped shirt, and dark green hair.

title: toei_animation
body:
A film and animation subsidiary of Toei Company, Ltd. Founded on January 23, 1943, it produced the first anime titles such as [[Mahou Tsukai Sally]] and [[Mazinger Z]] from which today's standards were set. 

Toei won the Animage Anime Grand Prix award for [[Ginga Tetsudou 999]] in 1981, [[Saint Seiya]] in 1987 and [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] in 1992. 

Other popular series that Toei produced/is producing include [[Hokuto no Ken]], [[Precure]], [[Dragon Ball]], [[One Piece]], [[Digimon]] and the first [[Yu-Gi-Oh! (toei)|]] anime.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Toei Animation":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toei_Animation]

title: moonlight_oath_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A limited time 4-star outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. It could only be acquired by purchasing it from the cash shop.

The outfit includes a [[long_dress|long]] [[strapless dress]] colored in a [[gradient_dress|gradient]] from light to dark [[blue_dress|blue]] and decorated with ornate patterns and gold [[jewelry]], a white [[stole]], and an almost floor length [[see-through_veil|transparent]] [[white veil]]. The hairstyle for this outfit is [[long_hair|long]] [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[brunette hair]] with [[long sidelocks]] and a [[braid]] that crosses the forehead.

It has an alternate color evolution with a dark purple dress, purple veil, and blue hair.

body:

The outfit includes a [[blue shirt]] with a fish design printed on it, a [[white jacket]], [[white pants]] with a [[brown belt]], a [[white hat]] tied around the chin with a [[ribbon]], [[blue boots]], [[long_gloves|long]] [[blue_gloves|blue]] [[fingerless glovess]]. The hairstyle for this outfit is just [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]]. The accessories included with this outfit are a [[brown bag]] and blue [[fish earrings]].

This outfit has an alternate color evolution which is mostly black.

title: starlet_burst_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it gives [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] the ability to shrink and ride around on her companion [[momo_(nikki)|Momo]]. It can be acquired by playing through the main story.

The outfit includes a [[short_dress|short]] [[blue dress]] decorated with a [[constellation_print|celestial motif]]. The top portion of the dress is covered by a white, [[frills|frilled]] garment with [[puffy sleeves]], while the skirt portion of the dress is puffy and resembles a pair of bloomers. The hairstyle for this outfit is [[long_hair|long]], [[wavy_hair|wavy]], [[blue hair]] styled into [[twintails]]. Accessories for this outfit include several [[star_hair_ornament|star-shaped hair accessories]] and a flat, six-pointed [[white hat]] with [[pom_pom_(clothes)|pom poms]] dangling from each point.

It has an alternate colored evolution that is primarily yellow and orange.

title: starlit_celebration_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. It was given to players for free to celebrate [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki's]] birthday on December 6th, 2024.

The outfit includes a primarily pink, purple, and white [[multicolored_dress|multicolored]], [[layered_dress|layered dress]] and pink [[high_heels|high heels]]. The dress is decorated with ribbons and stars and is made of a [[glitter_dress|glittery material]]. The hairstyle included with the outfit is a pair of [[two-toned_hair|two-toned]] pink and purple [[twin drills]]. Accessories included with the outfit include a [[tiara]], pink [[leg_ribbon|ribbon leg wraps]], and a star shaped [[star_wand|wand]].

It has an alternate colored evolution that has a primarily yellow and blue color scheme instead.

body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Hoshimachi Suisei]]. It was first revealed during her first solo 3D live concert "[i]STELLAR into the GALAXY[/i]".

It consists of a [[white shrug|white]]  with [[frilled sleeves|frilled]] [[quilted clothes|quilted]] [[juliet sleeves]], a [[blue brooch|blue]] [[brooch]], a [[frilled shirt|frilled]] [[blue shirt|blue]] [[vertical-striped shirt|vertical-striped]] [[pinstripe shirt]] under a [[blue vest]], s [[single glove|single]] a [[blue gloves]] [[single glove|single]] [[single half glove|half glove]], [[blue shorts]] a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[layered skirt|layered]] [[half-skirt|half]] [[overskirt]] with the outmost layer being a [[two-sided skirt]] with a [[pinstripe skirt|pinstripe patter]] on the outside and a [[starry sky print]] on the inside, a blue [[o-ring thigh strap]],  [[blue footwear|blue]] [[uneven footwear]] consisting of a [[single thigh boot]] and a wide boot, both of them with [[colored shoe soles|colored soles]] and [[platform heels]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[long hair]] in a [[half updo]] with a [[single side bun]], decorated with a [[tilted headwear|tilted]] [[crown]] on one side and multiple [[star hair ornament]]s on the other.

title: tomodachi_life
body:
A life-simulation game for the Nintendo 3DS by [[Nintendo]] featuring [[Mii_(Nintendo)|Miis]] initially released in 2013 as a sequel to the Japan-exclusive Nintendo DS game Tomodachi Collection released in 2009. The game would later be released in June 2014 in North America, Europe and Australia, and would get a Korean version in July 2014.

The game is titled [i]Tomodachi Collection: New Life[/i] (トモダチコレクション 新生活) in Japan, while Tomodachi Life was renamed as [i]Friend Gathering Apartment[/i] (친구모아 아파트) in South Korea.

title: living_saint
body:
A Living Saint is an extraordinarily devout servant of the Emperor of Mankind, usually a warrior of the Ecclesiarchy, who displays seemingly miraculous, supernatural abilities derived from potent faith in the God-Emperor during his or her lifetime. In almost every case, a Living Saint has been resurrected from the dead, sometimes multiple times. The belief among the faithful of the Imperial Creed is that these individuals are blessed by the Emperor Himself, and are resurrected by His will and grace to defend His servants.

Most of the known Living Saints have been members of the Adepta Sororitas, particularly its Orders Militant, but several have also emerged from the ranks of the Astra Militarum.

In truth, it is clear that Living Saints draw their powers from the Warp much like the servants of Chaos, but are not necessarily psykers during their initial lifetimes. Instead, a Living Saint's faith in the God-Emperor is so great that it allows them to unconsciously draw upon the Warp to fuel supernatural abilities, including the ability to resurrect from death. 

https://warhammer40k.fandom.com/wiki/Living_Saint

title: dreamcatcher
body: In Native American culture, a handmade object based on a willow hoop, on which is woven a loose net or web. The dreamcatcher is then decorated with personal and sacred items such as feathers and beads.

title: robin_(fire_emblem)
body:
A customizable character in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]]. Can be [[robin (male) (fire emblem)|male]] or [[robin (female) (fire emblem)|female]]. Default gender is male and default name (which is also the name given to the character in [[Super Smash Bros.]] for 3DS/Wii U) is [b]Robin[/b] ([b]Rufure[/b]/[b]Reflet[/b] in the Japanese version). Has little memory of the past, but is a gifted tactician.

Also known in the English versions as an [b]Avatar[/b].

title: pat_a_mat
body: A Czechoslovak stop-motion silent animated series about two friends who keep coming up with the most asinine solutions to practical problems, each episode ending happily, collateral damage be damned. Quite popular in its native Czech Republic and Slovakia, as well as, surprisingly, the Netherlands (due to its choice to dub over the two friends with voices), and spreading internationally due to its accessibility.

body:
"私は高品質のビデオゲームのリップをアップロードするだけです。"
"I only upload high quality video game rips."

Previously known as GiIvaSunner, SiIvaGunner is a YouTube parody channel that uploads video game music, but the music itself is remixed in some fashion (the uploads being dubbed high-quality rips). It is visually represented by the character of the (largely) same name, [[SilvaGunner]].

title: vision_(genshin_impact)
body:
The proof that one has been granted the power of an element by the gods in [[Genshin Impact]]. It is usually represented by a [[gem]] with its respective element's color and symbol.

The vision's appearance differs depending on which region the wielder is from. The designs are as follows:

* Mondstadt: Circular, sometimes oval, and with winged shapes on the bottom and spikes on top. "Example":[/posts/4729924] (hanging from Diluc's belt).
* Liyue: Square, features facets, and whose housing consists of a point-side down square overlaid atop a octagon/truncated square. "Example":[/posts/5936072] (attached to Yelan's leg).
* Inazuma: Circular, surrounded by a full circular bow housing with a stylized knot at the bottom. "Example":[/posts/4932976] (attached to Kujou Sara's belt).
* Sumeru: Circular, with a leaf-shaped housing that has large points facing to the side, and small points facing downwards. "Example":[/posts/5499267] (attached to Tighnari's belt).
* Fontaine: Circular, inlaid in a thin border shaped like two ribbons with ornamental clamshell designs on the sides. Comes in two different forms based on the holder's Arkhe alignment:
** Pneuma-aligned characters possess Visions whose border extends into two criss-crossing ribbons around a spike on top and bottom, with its clamshell ornaments pointing upwards on the left and downwards on the right. "Example":[/posts/6715419] (attached to the pouch on Charlotte's right leg).
** Ousia-aligned characters possess Visions whose border extends into a spiral on top and bottom, with its clamshell ornaments pointing downwards on the left and upwards on the right. "Example":[/posts/6851993] (attached to Navia's upper left arm).
** [[Furina (genshin impact)|]]'s Vision, befitting her ability to switch Arkhe alignments, borrows elements from both Pneuma- and Ousia-aligned Visions. It is set in a frame that has clamshell ornaments pointing downwards on the left and upwards on the right (representing Ousia) and an elongated spike on the bottom (representing Pneuma), with four prongs holding the gem in place. "Example":[/posts/6850933] (attached to the bow on Furina's right hip).
* Natlan: Circular, inlaid in a thin border shaped as a saltire with insignia resembling spiral greca patterns common in Mesoamerican culture, such as in xicalcoliuhqui motifs. A spike adorns the in-between of the saltire points, resembling a [[primogem]] star. "Example":[/posts/8031896] (attached to Kachina's upper right arm).
* Snezhnaya: Circular, with angled protrusions on the side, similar appearance to a military badge. "Example":[/posts/7318295] (attached to Arlecchino's upper back).

body:

Centering around cozy and comfy loungewear, it is a composite costume utilizing her default 2.0 model as a base, and consists of three distinct appearances: one with a [[white shirt|white]] and [[green shirt|green]] [[t-shirt]], one with a [[green sweater]] [[bare shoulders|exposing her shoulders]], and one with a pair of [[pink overalls]] that can go over the shirt, the sweater, or neither, simply showing her [[bra]] underneath.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, her hair is tied into [[twintails]] that is held with a [[green hairband]].

It's a [[maid]] costume consisting of a [[black hat|black]] [[beret]] or [[nurse cap]], a [[black dress|black]] [[collared dress]] with [[see-through cleavage]], [[see-through sleeves|see-through]] [[puffy short sleeves]] and a [[side slit]], a [[double-breasted]] [[grey apron]] with a [[chest belt]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], a [[crinoline]], a [[black pantyhose]], and black [[strappy heels]]. She also has an optional double-breasted [[grey coat|grey]] [[trench coat]] with this costume and carries a golden [[halberd|poleaxe]] as a nod to her moniker of "Suicopath".

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[long hair]] in a [[single braid|single]] [[side braid]] [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulder]] with [[double-parted bangs]] and a [[hairclip]].

She also has [[mismatched earrings]] with a [[star earrings|star earring]] and an [[earclip]] on her left ear and [[multiple earrings|multiple]] [[hoop earrings]] and [[ear piercing]]s on her right ear.

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this attire is [[long hair]] with [[braided bangs]] is multiple [[hairclip]]s, including a [[crescent hair ornament|crescent-shaped]] one, multiple [[star hair ornament|star-shaped ones]] an a [[x hair ornament]].
